loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana se encuentra muy feliz por apoyo brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en KIVA, ya que gracias al primer financiamiento solicitado ella pudo cumplir su meta de fortalecer la tierra y cultivos mediante la compra de abono, fertilizantes, entre otros que ayudaron a ser parte de un gran desarrollo para poder sacar una excelente cosecha de maíz y frijol. Ella pudo obtener alrededor de 15 cargas de maíz y frijol las cuales no ha podido vender ya que el precio en el mercado está bajo y hoy en día solicita un segundo crédito con el cual sembrara la postrera por lo que ella podrá obtener una mayor cosecha y esperar que el precio aumente en el mercado así ganara un poco más de tiempo y podrá esperar la alza en el mercado y poder vender el grano ya recolectado una parte y la otra retenerla para mejorar las ganancias e invertir en la siembra del próximo año. Ella espera que se le sea nuevamente apoyada para poder seguir siendo apoyada para poder salir adelante y en algún momento formar un capital propio.
texts.en: Juana is very happy with the support from the COMIXMUL cooperative in alliance with the KIVA investors. Thanks to the first loan she asked for she was able to meet her goal of fortifying the soil and the crops by buying fertilizer, among other things. These helped her to be a part of a big development and be able to obtain an excellent corn and bean harvest. She hasn't been able to sell them because the market price is low. Today she is asking for a second loan to plant the back field so she can obtain a better harvest and wait for the market price to go up. This way, she will have a little more time and be able to wait for the market to rise and sell a part of the grains that have already been harvested and keep the other part to improve her earnings and invest in next year's crop. She hopes that she will be supported again so she can get ahead and at some time, have her own capital.

loans.use: to invest in her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Emily is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her dry goods business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian es un joven de 24 años de edad, para poder salir adelante y poder llevar un sustento para su familia, ya que es padre de un pequeño de 2 años a quien quiere mucho; trabaja como empleado de seguridad en una institución de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Christian está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar materiales para empezar a construir su vivienda, con lo cual podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Terminar de construir su vivienda y darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Christian is a 24 year old young man. In order for him to get ahead and to make a living for his family, now that he is the father of a small 2 year old son who he loves very much, he works as a security guard for a business in his city. He works about 12 hours each day and he thinks that it is going well because he is very responsible with his work. 

Christian is grateful for the Kiva loans. Thanks to their support he will be able to buy materials to begin building his home. With his new home he will be able to improve the quality of life for his family and be able to continue the struggle to make his greatest dream a reality: to complete the construction of his home and to raise his son to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en: Sambath, originally from Banteay Meanchey province, is 58 years old and married. She has five children, one of whom is in school. To deal with the daily cost of living,she  raises fish for sale. This is the fifth loan for Sambath with VisionFund  (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her loan completely and it has improved her living conditions promptly. For this cycle, she joins a group of two to get a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy fish feed. She hopes that she can fatten her fish healthily so as she can sell them at a good price.

loans.use: To buy fish feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
A villager from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Lorn is married and blessed with two children.  She earns a living via two hectares of rice farming as the main source of her income with the support of her husband. It is the business that she has had for more than 30 years.  

This is not the first loan for Lorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which she repaid with success has enabled her to support her business and to cover the needs in her family, especially her children's education. Now, she is applying for a loan to support her daughter’s tuition fee and to buy a decent computer as a study aid for her daughter. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To support her daughter’s tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 27 years old and  a married mother, blessed with two dependent children. To cover the daily basic needs in the family, she does cassava farming on two hectares area and supplements the family income via a small stall charging batteries, a leasing service including a loud speaker, and a rice mill. She has been with these businesses for seven years. 

Mom, a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has repaid her past loan wisely and it has helped her to support her business promptly. For this new cycle, she  is applying for a new loan to  fix the car which supports her leasing business and to pay for weeding fees and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before .

loans.use: To pay for weeding fees and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Ri's Group

texts.en: Ri is 33 years old and a mother blessed with one child who is in school. To earn a living, she farms one and a half hectares of rice and two hectares of cassava; it is a business that she has had since she was 20 years old. This is the first loan for Ri with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has formed a group of two to take out a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy herbicide for her crops and to pay the labor costs of weeding. She hopes to gain a good yield from her cash-crop.

loans.use: To buy herbicide for her crops and to pay the labor costs of weeding

loans.name: Elida Elizeth

texts.es:
Elida es una joven muy luchadora y emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante de 25 años de edad la cual comparte hogar junto a su esposo y su única hija menor de edad y está estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad donde juntos en familia habitan. Elida aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura ya que desde muy pequeña apoyaba a sus padres en la tierra que el cultivaban. Sus cultivos están ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan en vestía o caminando aproximadamente a 5 kilómetros de distancia. Elida no tiene ningún grado de educación por lo que hoy en día se esmera y se esfuerza diariamente para que su hija tenga más oportunidades en la vida. 

Ella sueña con ver a su hija en un mejor futuro, con mejores oportunidades, mejores condiciones de vida para que pueda apoyar a su familia en todo lo necesario. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Elida is an enterprising young woman who is a fighter and who really wants to get ahead. She is 25 years old and shares her home with her husband and her young daughter, her only child, who is going to school in the community where they live as a family. Elida learned the agriculture trade from the time she was very young when she helped her parents on the land they farmed. Her crops are located in the same community and she gets there by going in a bus or walking approximately 5 kilometers. Elida does not have any education and for that reason today she works hard every day so her daughter will have more opportunities in life.  

She dreams of her daughter having a better future with better opportunities and a better quality of life so she can help her family with everything they need. That is why today she is asking for a loan with which she can improve her crops, helping them more by applying agricultural materials such as fertilizer, coffee formula, and fungicides that will stop contamination by bugs and diseases.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Henry Octavio

texts.es: Henry Octavio mayor de edad casado con cuatro hijos menores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio, la caña, azúcar y el ron, Henry es un microempresario que se dedica a la carpintería/ebanistería donde elabora diversos estilos de muebles como: camas, roperos, comodas, chineros, centro de entretenimientos, cunas, sillas, mesas de comedor entre otros mas, al igual que también tiene una pequeña pero modesta pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo para el hogar , productos congelados, golosinas, detergentes entre otros productos mas, sus ventas las realiza en aserrillos del municipio y para su otro negocio en camiones distribuidores todas estas compras las realiza al contado, uno de sus sueños es de poder terminar de mejorar su vivienda e incrementar mas su pulperia y tener mayor materia primar para su carpintería. El objetivo de este crédito es para comprar materia prima como: madera, clavos, pega al igual que productos de consumo para el hogar, y unas laminas de zin para su carpintería y no mojarse la madera.  Henry agadece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Henry Octavio is a married adult with four minor children. He is from one of the towns in the Chinandega area where commerce, sugar cane, sugar and rum dominate. Henry is a micro-businessman who works in carpentry/ furniture making. He makes different styles of furniture such as beds, wardrobes, dressers, china cabinets, entertainment centers, cradles, chairs, dining room tables and more. He also has a small and modest convenience store where he offers consumer goods for the home, such as frozen food, snacks, detergent and more. He sells in one of the town's lumberyards and for his other business he buys from distribution trucks, paying up front. One of his dreams is to be able to finish improving his home and expanding his convenience store more and having raw materials for his carpentry. The purpose of this loan is to buy raw materials such as wood, nails, and glue, as well as consumer products for the home and some zinc sheeting for his carpentry shop so the wood won't get wet. Henry is grateful for the support that the Kiva investors are offering to people with low income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his carpenter's shop and consumer goods for the home.

loans.name: Sanghem's Group

texts.en:
Sanghem, a 61-year-old local cassava farmer residing in Memot district of Kampong Cham province, is married and has nine children. She has been involved in her current business for 14 years. 

This will be the fifth loan for Sanghem’s group, which consists of two female borrowers seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Her past loans have enabled Sanghem to support her business, and she will spend her new loan portion to pay the weeding fee for her cassava. 

She hopes to gain a good yield from her cassava and make more income.

loans.use: To pay the weeding fee for her cassava

loans.name: Adjo Semehela

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme célibataire. Elle revend des sachets d’eaux et divers à tous. Elle exerce depuis 2007. Elle demande son troisième crédit auprès de WAGES pour acheter des sachets d’emballages et divers puis investir dans l’activité pour avoir une grande étalage.
texts.en: Adjo is an unmarried woman. She resells pouches of water and various goods to anyone. She has been in this business since 2007. She is asking for her third loan from WAGES for purchasing various items and some pouches as packaging. Then she will invest in her business in order to have a large display of goods.

loans.use: to buy pouches of water and oil to sell

loans.name: Frank Italo

texts.es:
Frank es un joven de 22 años, el cual trabaja como vendedor en un tienda de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día, lo cual le permite tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, Frank cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy carismáticos y e buen vendedor.

Fran agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abarrotes como arroz en saco, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, lo cual le permitirá tener alimentos para su familia y ahorrar ya que comprara por mayor y así seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño: “Tener casa propia”.
texts.en:
Frank is a young 22-year-old man.  He works as a salesman at a store in the city for about nine hours each day.  This allows him to earn an income, and he is therefore able to move himself ahead.  Frank believes that everything is going well at work because he is very charismatic and is a good salesman.

Frank is thankful for the support that the Kiva investors have offered him.  Thanks to this help, he will be able to buy groceries (sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, and other items) and to provide for his whole family.  By buying groceries wholesale, he will also save some money and can continue fighting to make his greatest dream a reality: to have his own home.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doña María Esmeralda es una mujer de 39 años de edad en un estado civil de unión libre, emprendedora, luchadora y madre de cuatro hijos los cual vive con ellos. Ella se dedican en compañía de su conyugue a las diferentes actividades de cultivo y producción de café el cual aprendió hace 5 años siendo su pareja quien le enseñara a trabajar y a realizar las diferentes actividades como, limpieza, abono, corte, riego, etc. Sus cultivos están ubicados en la misma propiedad donde está su casa de habitación por lo que esto les permite dar una mejor y personalizada asistencia a sus cultivos. Doña María Esmeralda tiene un grado de educación primario incompleto el cual pudo cursar hasta el cuarto grado por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado de sus padres a pesar de las diferentes dificultades. Sus sueños son educar sus hijos para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida y que obtengan un título a nivel universitario, los conocimientos necesarios para poder desempeñare en la vida y también poder formar un patrimonio sólido para su familia y hacer de sus cultivos atractivos para sus clientes ya que de esa manera ella podrá generara mejores ingresos.

Doña María Esmeralda actualmente solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 3 QQ de abono, 3 QQ de urea, 3 litros de fórmula 20/20 ya que es necesario asistir y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos como también extenderlos para generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
María Esmeralda is a 39 year old woman in a common law marriage. She is an entrepreneur, a fighter, and the mother of her four children who live with her and her partner. She works, together with her partner, on different activities related to the cultivation and production of coffee. She learned how to do this 5 years ago alongside her partner who taught her how to to perform the different activities like cleaning, fertilizing, cutting, irrigation, etc. Her crops are located in the same property as her home because this allows her to provide a better and more personal level of assistance to her crops. 

María Esmeralda has an incomplete primary education that allowed her to study up to the 4th grade. She is thankful for the support she was given by her parents to complete this, in spite of their economic difficulties. Her dreams are to educate her children so that they can have a better quality of life and they can receive a degree from a university with the knowledge that they need to to be able to succeed in life;  to create a solid legacy for her family; and to grow attractive crops for her clients so that she will obtain better profits. 

María Esmeralda is currently seeking financing through the cooperative COMIXMUL to buy 3 kilos of fertilizer, 3 kilos of urea, and 3 liters of formula 20/20 because it is necessary to support and provide maintenance for her crops and to also lengthen their growth so that she will generate better profits for her home and her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, and a formula for coffee growth, among other items for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lang's Group

texts.en: A local farmer residing in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Lang is a married mother of one kid. To strive for a living, she has grown rice as her core income-generating business for ages. She is leading a group of four second-time clients with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Lang is applying for 1,200,000 KHR and her other members are each seeking loans of 1,000,000 KHR. Lang has successfully repaid her previous loan in full, and the funds enabled her to uplift her lifestyle. Lang will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her business so that she can expand it to be even better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Gloria Estrella

texts.es:
Doña Gloria tiene 39 años de edad ella es casada y es madre de familia de 6 hijos los cuales trabajan en la tierra apoyando a sus padres en las diferentes actividades que diariamente se realizan como: la limpieza, aplicación de abono, foliares, etc. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completada gracias al esfuerzo que sus padres hicieron en su juventud. Doña Gloria es una mujer muy hogareña, trabajadora y humilde la cual también colabora con el cuidado de sus hijos y a su esposo apoyándoles diariamente en la elaboración de sus alimentos, etc. ya que en familia se dedican a la caficultura por tradición familiar fueron sus padres quienes a ella le enseñaron dicha actividad. La tierra que en familia trabajan es propia la cual está ubicada a 40 minutos de camino trasladándose diariamente caminando para dar el mantenimiento necesario. 

Sus sueños son apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios verlos graduados a nivel universitario y darles una mejor calidad y estilo de vida. Como meta comprar una manzana de tierra para posteriormente cultivarla de una variedad diferente de café haciendo de esta más atractiva para el mercado local. Por lo que ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de insumos como abono, foliares, urea, etc. para asistir sus cultivos de café y obtener una excelente cosecha la cual pueda ser vendida en el mercado exitosa mente.
texts.en:
Gloria is thirty-nine years old.  She is married and is the mother of six children.  All of the kids help out with the farming, supporting their parents by carrying out various daily activities like cleaning, spreading fertilizer, applying liquid plant feed, etc.  She completed a primary level of education thanks to the efforts that her parents made when she was young.

Gloria is a very family-oriented, hardworking, and humble woman.  She works to take care of her children and husband, supporting them every day by preparing their meals, etc.  The entire family is dedicated to growing coffee because of tradition; Gloria's parents were the ones who taught her this trade.  The lands that the family works are their own, and are located a 40-minute walk away.  They walk to their lands every day in order to maintain their crops.

Her dreams are to support her children in their studies, and to see them graduate from university.  She hopes to give them a better quality and style of life.  She also has a goal of buying 1.75 acres of land on which she can later grow all different types of coffee, making her products more attractive in the local market.

Gloria is therefore requesting financing to purchase supplies, like fertilizers, liquid plant feed, urea, etc. to maintain her coffee crops.  This will allow her to have an excellent harvest and to then successfully sell her products at the market.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Patrocinia es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles lo cual también sale a vender en otros lugares de otros productos. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carne, harina, huevos, condimentos y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
This group called, Mujeres Emprendedoras 2, is in its fifth cycle in the Comité de Mujeres program in the city of Concepcion, which is a growing central area.  It’s an area that’s difficult to access and the members are working to grow, provide a better environment, and continue growing slowly.

Patrocinia is one of the members.  She sells food and goes out to sell other products in other areas. She wants to improve her future little by little and for all the people in her zone to be able to provide more security and a better future to their families.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy ingredients such as meat, flour eggs, condiments, and other things so that she can continue to make her foods and be able to continue growing with her business.  She wants to be able to provide her family with everything they need and deprive them of anything.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: San Pablo 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamada SUAN PABLO 2 está empezando a trabajar, se formó en una zona bastante rural de la ciudad de concepción, una zona de difícil acceso.
La Sra.  Esmilda  es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona muy alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de comestible, ella por medio de este trabajo busca dar a su familia lo que necesitan y que no pasen por necesidades.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para sus comestibles, ya que así podrá seguir preparándolos y tener los ingresos para su familia.
En la foto aparecen 18 señoras, ya que el grupo tiene esa cantidad de miembros, pero 3 de ellas no retiran crédito en este ciclo, pero de igual forma están en el grupo.
texts.en:
This group is called SUAN PABLO 2 and is located in a very rural part of the city of Concepcion.  It’s an area that’s difficult to access.

Esmilda is one of the members and is from a distant area where she has her small business and sells food.  She wants to be able to provide her family with what they need.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy ingredients so she can continue preparing her dishes and have supplies for her family.

There are 18 women in the picture, but three of them are not receiving loans during this cycle.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Aracely Luz

texts.es: Aracely de 34 años de edad y habita junto a su grupo familiar el cual está constituido por su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 16 años, 13 años y 8 años de edad. Junto a su compañero de vida llevan el sustento a su hogar. Ella se dedica al comercio de tortillas( preparación alimenticia de masa de maíz), dentro de su hogar. Cuenta con muchos clientes ya que ella es una  mujer amable, respetuosa y responsable. Su principal patrimonio es vivienda que aunque es muy humilde es propia. Por el momento no cuenta con energía eléctrica y desea hacer la instalación del cableado eléctrico para la introducción de la misma. Además, desea levantar una pared con el fin de darle mayor seguridad a su casa. Aracely solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera; además,  invertir en la introducción de la luz eléctrica y dar a su familia mejores  condiciones.
texts.en: Aracely is 34 years old and lives with her life partner and three children, ages 16, 13, and 8.  She and her husband support the home.  She sells tortillas from her home and has many customers because she is very friendly, respectful, and responsible.  Even though her home is humble, it belongs to her but she doesn't have electricity at the moment.  She wants to install cabling, as well as adding a wall in order to improve the security of her home.  Aracely is asking for this loan through FUSAI so she can buy galvanized metal, nails and lumber.  She also wants to install electricity so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.
 
Kanze has operated a milk selling business at the market for the past three years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase gallons of milk for resale. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in society.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for resale.

loans.name: Mercy Yadira

texts.es:
Mercy es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora de 36 años de edad, madre soltera de 2 hijos los cuales están en una edad escolar cursando diferentes grados de educación en una escuela de la comunidad por lo que ella diariamente lucha para que ellos tengan un mejor futuro y una mejor vida. Con el trabajo de campo que ella realiza colaboran sus padres y sus hermanos apoyándola en lo necesario para obtener un buen cultivo sano y seguro de enfermedades y plagas. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria completo pero no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo por parte de sus padres en ese entonces. Ella es caficultora desde hace muchos años siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra y que hoy en día lo sigue haciendo ya que como único medio de ingreso económico para su familia es necesario y rentable. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona la cual caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico. El terreno que ella tiene es propio y lo adquirió por medio de una herencia por parte de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación y se traslada hasta el caminando.
Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación dando variedad a sus clientes y todos aquellos que consumen su producto ya que de esa forma pella podrá generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar para fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos y que sean ellos los que sigan trabajando la tierra de generación en generación. Por lo que hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar insumos agrícolas para dar el mantenimiento necesario y posible para poder obtener una buena cosecha de café y aprovechar para preparar su tierra para la próxima temporada.
texts.en:
Mercy is a fighter and entrepreneur. She is 36 years old, a single mother of two children. They are studying in different grades in a local elementary school.  It is for them that Mercy fights so that they have a better future and life. She works along with the help of her parents and siblings in the fields doing whatever is necessary to obtain a good crop, safe from infestations. She has a degree in Primary Education but couldn't continue her studies as she didn't have her parents support at that time. She has been a coffee grower for many years now. It was her parents who taught her to work the land. 

Today she continues to do that as it is the only source of income necessary to support her family and it is profitable. The product is sold to intermediaries who come to the area and they qualify her product as being of quality and clean. The land she works is her own. She got it as an inheritance from her parents. It is located three kilometers from her house and she gets to it on foot. 

Her future plans are to possess a large plantation offering variety to her clients and those who consume her product. Doing so will generate greater income and strengthen the estate for her children and grandchildren as it will be them working the land in the coming generations.

Mercy is requesting help to buy agricultural supplies to do the necessary maintenance and to obtain a good harvest and prepare the land for the next season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, foliar spray, urea, and others to apply to her coffee crops.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad bastante alejada del centro del País, donde hay poco acceso a medios de comunicación y se puede decir a la seguridad.
La Sra. Nidia es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su  negocio de despensa, y cuenta que con mucho trabajo pudo montarlo y hoy en día ya es muy conocida por los buenos precios que tiene uy por su amabilidad. Ella desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias.
Nidia quiere surtir su negocio, es por eso que pide este crédito, para poder comprar comestibles en general, bebidas, panificados y otros insumos de primera necesidad para seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
San Miguel is from the city of Curuguaty, a city a good distance away from the center of the country; there is little access to communication media and one can also say, to security.

Nidia is one of the members.  She has a grocery store and says that she was able to set it up with great effort and now she is well known because of the low prices and friendliness.  She wants to improve her future little by little and for all the people in her zone to be able to provide more security and a better future to their families.

Nidia wants to stock her business so she is asking for a loan to buy general food items like drink, breads, and other food products and primary need items so she can continue to work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: 29 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 29 de Setiembre, está  en su ciclo número 5 del programa comité de mujeres, son de la comunidad de Yasy Cañy perteneciente a la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona aun en crecimiento, que las integrantes quieren ir mejorando para dar mejor seguridad a sus hijos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marta, quien se dedica a una actividad agrícola, la cual es la cría y venta de animales de corral, y con esto esta ayudando a su familia. Comenta que es muy sacrificado, pero lo hace, y que sabe que la única forma de salir adelante es trabajando y esforzándose.
Ella solicita de este apoyo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales y así seguir con su pequeño emprendimiento rural
texts.en:
The 29 de Setiembre, group is in its fifth cycle in the Comité de Mujeres, in the Yasy Cañy community of the city of Curuguaty.  This is a growing area that the members want to improve so that they can provide better security for their children.

Marta is one of the members and she’s a farmer who raises and sells corral animals and helps her family in this way.  She says that it’s a lot of hard work, but she does it and knows that the only way to get ahead is through hard work and sacrifice.

She is asking for this support so that she can buy balanced feed for her animals and continue with her small rural business.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Phary

texts.en: A young mother of one child, Phary is in her early mid-20s and is a resident from Sa Ang district of Kandal province. Her main sources of family income are from grocery and pig-raising businesses. Having been involved in her current businesses for three years, Phary is able to generate about 27,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s Field Partner), Phary is not a first-time borrower. She has repaid back her past loan wisely and it has enabled her to support both of her businesses in a timely manner. For this cycle, she gets a new loan in order to buy pig’s feed and more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To buy pig’s feed and more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a married man with eight children. Two are in school and the rest are adults. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twenty years, he has been selling cows, goats, and chicks at the market to the general public. The main challenge for his business has been unstable market prices. He joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase chicks and goats for his business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and goats for his business.

loans.name: Abel Ezequiel

texts.es: Abel Ezequiel 31 años de edad casado con 3 hijos menores de edad  originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, Abel se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado, responsable con muchos deseos de superación personal, tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo como: granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, frijoles aceite, detergentes, sal pamperes, papel higiénicos, maruchan, tollas sanitarias, salsas de tomates, golosinas, leña, huevos entre otros, inicia su negocio con fondos propios, con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su casa de habitación para asi brindarles mejores condiciones de vidas a su familia, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su pulperia en la compra de productos de consumo debido a que su demanda ha crecido por la buena atención que el ha tenido con sus clientes atendiéndolos desde muy temprano y cerrando bastante tarde para lo que los clientes necesiten de su negocio.
texts.en: Abel Ezequiel is 31 years old and is married with three young children. He is from one of the municipalities in the Chinandega zone, located in the western part of the country. Abel is known for being a hard working man who is honest and responsible with a lot of desire to achieve personal success. He has a small grocery store in his home where he offers goods for consumption like: basic grains, rice, sugar, oiled beans, soaps, salt, diapers, toilet paper, ramen, sanitary napkins, tomato sauce, candies, wood and eggs, among others. He began his business with his own funds with the goal of increasing his earnings. One of his dreams is to be able to improve his home so that he can provide better living conditions for his family. The objective of this loan is to invest it in his grocery store by purchasing consumptive goods. His demand has increased thanks to the good service and attention he has provided to his clients by serving them very early in the morning and closing his store very late based on his clients needs.

loans.use: to invest in his grocery store by purchasing goods for consumption like: basic grains, frozen food, soaps and wood, among others.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela de 35 años habita con su hijo de 7 años de edad,  en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde desarrolla una actividad comercial  desde hace  10 años, para generar ingresos y sostener su hogar. Su hermana fue participe en que esta idea de negocio fluyera, pues le ayudó a conseguir  el primer capital semilla, para comprar accesorios femeninos  y venderlos, a quienes los solicitaran, con el fin de  obtener utilidades. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y sus compras de contado a los proveedores que le ofrecen los mejores precios. Gisela sueña con tener una casa propia para brindarle un mejor bienestar a su hijo y este es el motor  de su tarea día a día. Los artículos de su oferta son los galletas, medicinas sin prescripción, hilos, vestidos casuales, la ropa deportiva,  accesorios y hasta muñecos de peluche. Para Gisela su mayor desafío  es encontrar fuentes de apoyo a su negocio, pero aun así ella no se detiene, porque en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará especialmente  jeans, y blusas, con lo cuales vestir a sus clientes el fin de año venidero, pues es una época de mucho movimiento comercial, que Gisela aprovechará muy bien, para lograr que su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en:
Gisela is 35 years old. She lives with her 7 year old son in a municipality close to the city of Barranquilla. She has been operating a business for 10 years, in order to generate income and support her household. The idea of a business originated from her sister and she helped Gisela get her first seed money to buy woman's accessories and sell them to whoever wanted them with the goal of making some profit.

Her sales are on credit and she buys in cash from suppliers who offer the best price. Gisela dreams of owning her own house to provide more well-being for her son and this is what drives her daily work. The goods she offers are biscuits, over the counter medicine, thread, casual clothes, sports clothing, accessories and stuffed toys. 

For Gisela her major obstacle is to find support for her business. This is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy jeans and blouses for her clients to wear in the coming festive season. It is a busy time for business which Gisela wants to take full advantage of. She wants this loan from Kiva to be a success.

loans.use: to buy jeans and blouses.

loans.name: Theavy's Group

texts.en: Theavy, originally from Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province, is 29 years old and blessed with five children. Her family’s main sources of income are from rice farming, clothes selling, and her husband's occupation as a paid worker at a construction site. Theavy and two other borrowers in this group have been with VisionFund (Kiva's Field Partner) for more than one cycle. Theavy completely repaid her past loan and it has enabled her to support her living and provide the basic needs for her family on time. For this new cycle, she and her co-borrowers are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more clothes for resale. She hopes that she can gain a good profit from this business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is 45 years old and a married mother of six children. Currently, she needs to support only two children who are still in school. To overcome the family’s hardships, she does rice farming on two hectares of land while her husband works in a charcoal factory as a paid worker. She has been involved in this business for ages. This is not the first loan for Sopheap with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She repaid her past loan wisely to support her family. For this cycle, she is applying for an education loan for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree specializing in Finance and Banking. She hopes that her son can get a good after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay for a bachelor's degree for her son

location.town: Kompong Speu province, Phnom Srouch district

loans.name: Phirun

texts.en: Phirun is 51 years old and married. He is blessed with two schoolchildren residing in Sa Ang district of Kandal province. To deal with the daily cost of living, he works in house construction while his wife grows vegetables for resale. This is not the first micro loan for Phirun with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). He used his past loan wisely to upgrade his living conditions. For this cycle, he is applying for a new loan in order to buy fertilizer for his crops and buy leek seedlings for planting for extra income. He hopes that he can make a good income to support his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crops and buy leek seedlings

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik lives in Ijevan town with his wife and son. He earns his living by selling different clothing and dressmaking accessories to locals. Due to Arayik's hard and tireless work, he has gained many loyal customers. 

Now, in order to buy a new stock of clothing to offer to his customers, Arayik asks for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Arayik to be able to meet his clients' needs and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing.

loans.name: Duba

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Duba. She is married and has three children aged seven, fifteen and twenty four. She has two additional dependents who live with her and she helps with their education. In 1998, Duba established her palm oil business. The business started to help her husband who is a driver with the education of the children. Her business is located on the outskirts of town and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 768,675 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Duba requires a loan in order to buy palm oil and beans. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise her profit. In the future, Duba plans to expand business to the center of town. She started in this business selling for her mother, and now owns her own business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional palm oil and beans.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Martha. She is married and has three children age three, five and fourteen. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to help a sister with the education of her children. 

In 2003, Martha established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband, who is a mason, with the education of the children. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 844,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Martha requires a loan in order to pay for additional fish. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and raise the profit. 

In the future, Martha plans to expand business and start to do wholesale. She started the business selling on market days and now has a stall at the central market. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional fish

loans.name: Ibrahim A.

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has one child, age three. In 2001, Ibrahim established his motorbike rental business. The business allowed him to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in city centre, and his main customers are all ages and sexes. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 842,500 leones (SLL) every month from the business.

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He requires the loan in order to add to his fleet of bikes. He hopes that this loan can increase the fleet and increase his profit. In the future, Ibrahim plans to improve the business and expand to other towns. He started with one bike and now has two. If given the support, he wishes to grow bigger and expand. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a motorbike for his motorbike rental business

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe is from Armavir town where he lives with his parents. He has been involved in a retail business for many years and is the only breadwinner in his family. Vahe owns a truck which he uses to transport and sell different stones. Unfortunately, Vahe's truck is currently out of use, because its tires are too old. He has requested this loan to purchase 6 new tires so that he can continue his retail business. Vahe has been approved for the loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Vahe and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 6 tires for his truck

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Baby.  She is married and has five children age nine, fifteen, eighteen, twenty-four and thirty. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to help with the house chores.

In 2004, Baby established her palm oil, beans, and toiletries business. She began her business because she wanted to be self reliant and help her husband, who is a driver, with the education of the children. Her business is located on the outskirts and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,113,500 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Baby requires a loan in order to pay for additional palm oil and beans. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and raise the profit. In the future, Baby plans to to open a provision shop. This loan would be of great help because it can help her improve her living standards, with the profit made. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional palm oil, beans and toiletries

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 16, es un grupo ya antiguo, donde todas son amigas y se conocen, se ayudan para salir adelante. Esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les está ayudando a poder trabajar y mejorar.
Margarita es un ejemplo, ya que por medio de su trabajo de modista demuestra que con trabajo y esfuerzo se puede salir adelante. Es una persona con grandes ideales y metas, y es por esas metas que se está esforzando para poder cumplirlas y llegar a la meta. Quiere ir mejorando su taller y es por eso que va trabajando ciclo tras ciclo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar telas e hilos, y así seguir trabajando y a la vez cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y mejorar su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
This group, called Mujeres San Cayetano, is in its 16th cycle and all members are friends who help one another to get ahead.  They are participating in the survey to eliminate poverty and it’s helping them work and get ahead.

Margarita is an example.  Through her hard work as a dressmaker, she is demonstrating that she can get ahead.  She is a person with grand ideas and goals and she is working to achieve them.  She wants to improve her workshop so she works cycle after cycle.

She is asking for this loan to buy fabric and thread and be able to continue working, meet her customer demand, and improve her poverty situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards and enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. Apart from his stationery business, he leases rental houses. He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to renovate his rental houses. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Haja Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Haja.  She is married and has three children age four, seven and eighteen. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores. 

In 2003, Haja established her fish business. The business started to help her husband with the education of the children. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 874,050 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Haja requires a loan in order to buy additional fish. She hopes that this loan will improve the stock and raise the profits. In the future, Haja plans to expand business in the trade of local foodstuff. She started the business at home and now has expanded to the central market. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional fish

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  San Miguel  está en su ciclo número dos del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., son mujeres jefas de familia muy luchadoras.
Una de ellas es Alba, quien vende frutas de manera ambulante, ella siempre motiva a sus amigas a seguir trabajando y luchando, ya que sabe que eso tendrá sus frutos. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas frescas para la venta y así seguir procurando por mejorar su vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group, called San Miguel, is in its second cycle in the Comité de Mujeres program, where all work to help one another get ahead.  They are women heads of households and are very hardworking.

Alba is one of them and she sells fruit on foot.  She always motivates her friends to continue working hard, because she knows that this will have its rewards.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy fresh fruit to sell and continue to improve her life and that of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en: Vann is 34 years old and a married mother residing in Battambang province. She has one little kid to cater to. To sustain her family, she does rice farming and runs a small stall to sell grocery items. It is the business that she has had for five years. This is the first loan for Vann with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pigs for raising as extra income. Moreover, she will also spend some portion to buy pig feed. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her current business so she can expand her business larger than before.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes  del socorro mayor de edad casada con dos hijos mayores de edad del domicilio de Chinandega es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora con deseos de superación personal, se dedica a la venta de mercaderia en general como: variedades estilos de ropa para adultos y niños, diversos estilos de calzados al igual que los fines de semana ella vende sopa de gallina con albóndigas, Res y mondongo, ya son varios años de dedicarse a este negocio su negocio lo tiene de forma ambulante y domiciliar  los cuales ella tiene clientes fijos y eventuales a los que les ofrece crédito al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal lo invertido, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir mas en su negocio debido a que por la buena atención y variedades de productos que ofrece sus clientes los cuales ha crecido y tiene mayor demanda. Mercedes agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mercedes del Socorro is married and has 2 grown children.  She lives in the City of Chinandega.  She is a hardworking woman who strives for personal success.  She has a business selling general merchandise, such as clothing, in a variety of styles for adults and children, and she also sells a variety of styles of shoes.  Also, on the weekends she sells chicken soup with meatballs, beef, and tripe.  She's had this business now for a number of years.  She sells her products from place to place and from her home.  She has regular and occasional customers to whom she offers her products for cash or credit, collecting on a weekly basis.  

Mercedes' goal with this loan is to invest more in her business, since with the good service and variety of products she offers, her customer base is growing and there is more demand for her business. Mercedes thanks the Kiva lenders for the help that they are providing to low-income people in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as clothing and cosmetics, and to buy products to make delicious soups

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es: Isabel vende gallinas y fue apoyada en  el portal Kiva en la pasada temporada de Diciembre; ella agradece a sus financiadores, porque le fue muy bien y dice: ”Siempre que ustedes apoyen a gente como nosotros, nos están ayudando a salir adelante”. Su anterior inversión le ayudó a obtener nuevas ganancias con su venta de gallinas y con el negocio de empanadas y arepas. Isabel invierte el dinero de su negocio en lo que requiere cada época, por eso está aplicando una vez mas, a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará a solicitud de su clientela gallina, mercancía variada, ajustándose a la temporada del último trimestre del año, así visitará  a proveedores de ropa, calzado etc, para complacer a su clientela, comprando con su credikiva.
texts.en: Isabel sells cookies and was helped by Kiva last December.  She is grateful to the lenders because things went very well for her and she says, “Every time you support people like us, you are helping us get ahead.”  Her previous investment helped her obtain new earnings through her cookie, empanadas, and arpenas business.  Isabel reinvests the money from her business for what she needs every season, and she is asking for another Kiva loan to buy various products for the year end season, as requested by her customers.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy from suppliers of clothing, shoes, etc. to satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: A mother in her early 50s residing in Kampong Cham province, Nheb is married and has six children. Nowadays, she needs to support only one son, who is in school. For Nheb, rice farming is the main business that has helped her to cover the primary basic needs of her family. Nheb is taking out her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in order to pay tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in Information Technology. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees for her son

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Srey Santhor District

loans.name: Sorphea

texts.en: Originally from the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Sorphea is a mother of three kids who are in school. She is 40 years old and strives to make a living by rice farming. To supplement the family's income, her husband drives a tricycle-motorbike for a fee. She wants to keep her kids in school, but educational costs are quite a challenge for her. To overcome this challenge, she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is not the first loan for Sorphea with VisionFund. After the previous loan, which she has repaid successfully, she feels confident that she can improve her lifestyle soon. She will spend her entire loan to pay for tuition for her son, who is pursuing a bachelor's degree in Finance and Banking. She hopes that she can support her son until graduation so that he can get a good job.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s school fees

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.ru:
Ранохон более 20 лет работает продавщицей сладостей. У нее на рынке города Исфара, где она живет, есть прилавка, на которой продает конфеты, шоколад, мармелад, вафли, печенье и другое. Ранохону помогает ее невестка, так как она пожилая (ее возраст 63 года) и сама не может ходить за товаром. У Ранохона еще есть муж, сын и 3 внука. Ранохон любит свою работу, ее внуки тоже любят работу бабушки, потому что она каждый вечер угощает их сладостями.   
   Сейчас Ранохон хочет закупить новые виды конфет, печений и вафлей, чтобы увеличить продажу товара. По этой причине она просит кредит.
texts.en:
Ranokhon has been working for more than 20 years selling sweets. She has a stall at the market in the city of Isfara, where she lives, and sells candy, chocolate, fruit jellies, wafers, cookies, etc. Her daughter-in-law helps her, as Ranokhon is getting old (she is 63) and cannot go and pick up goods on her own. Ranokhon also has a husband, a son and three grandchildren. She loves her work and her grandchildren also love their grandmother's work, because every evening she treats them with sweets. 

Now Ranokhon wants to buy new types of candy, cookies and wafers in order to increase her sales. For this reason she is asking for a loan.

loans.use: to buy confectionary products, including wafers, chocolate and cookies, to increase inventory

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco vive en la comunidad de Huayllabamba en el distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de Artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos en base de lana de alpaca y oveja. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana, él  agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. El cliente pertenece al banco comunal Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba  y sus reuniones son cada treinta días en la casa de uno de los clientes.
texts.en: Francisco lives in the Huayllabamba Community, within the Huancarani district, in the Paucartambo province, Cusco department of Peru.  He makes arts and crafts from alpaca and sheep wool.  This time he needs a loan to buy supplies such as wool.  He appreciates and values the loan and is committed to making his monthly payments responsibly.  He is a member of the Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba communal bank and they meet at one of the member’s home every two weeks.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, 32 and a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is married and has four children who are still young. For the sake of her kids, she plants rice as the primary source of income. Engaging in her current business for several years, Sopheap is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Sopheap and the first loan for her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  The past successful loan, which she has repaid completely, enabled her to improve her living conditions. 

For this cycle, she is seeking 400,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more income from her business and expand it to a bigger scale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sandra Maritza

texts.es:
Sandra tiene un grado de educación primario completo que sus padres con mucho esfuerzo y empeño apoyaron para que ella pudiese estudiar y sacar la primaria. Ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales colaboran con sus padres a elaborar las diferentes actividades en sus cultivos de café como la limpieza, aplicación de abono, entre otros que son necesarios para mantener atractivos sus cultivos. Ella es agricultora desde muy temprana edad gracias a sus padres por tradición y sus clientes son las bodegas en los alrededores de la zona donde ella habita, intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos de la zona que compran el producto para la adquisición del producto al final de cada cosecha y poder re venderlo. La tierra que trabaja en compañía de su esposo es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 30 minutos de camino a la cual se trasladan caminando diariamente.
 Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 800 unidades de chapola para cultivar, 8 sacos de abono, 6 litros de foliares, 6 litros de boro y 90 cargas de café para su cultivo ya que con esto ella pretende agrandar más sus cultivos y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos.
 Los planes a futuro son los de mejorar sus cosechas de café fortaleciéndolas con los diferentes insumos que comprara, sembrar la nueva plantilla de café para agrandar más sus cultivos y cubrir una mayor demanda. Como madre ofrecerles a sus hijos la mejor educación, un mejor estilo de vida, y un patrimonio sólido para el futuro.
texts.en:
Sandra completed primary school supported by her parents´ effort and determination, which enabled her to study and get her primary school education. She is married and the mother of four children who collaborate with their parents to do different work on the coffee crops, such as cleaning, compost application, and other things that are necessary to help keep the crops attractive.

She has been a farmer since she was very young, thanks to her parents´ traditions. Her clients are the grocery stores around the area where she lives, middle-men who come to the area, and neighbors of the area who purchase her products so that they can acquire them at the end of each harvest and re-sell them. The land she works with the help of her husband is her own property, thanks to an inheritance from her parents. It is located 30 minutes away, and they walk to it daily.

She has requested financing from the COMIXMUL cooperative for the purchase of 800 units of coffee seedlings for cultivation, eight sacks of compost, six liters of liquid fertilizer, six liters of boron, and 90 loads of coffee for cultivating, with which she hopes to be able to expand her harvest and build up her children´s inheritance.

Her future plans are to improve her coffee harvests, strengthening them with the different supplies she will buy, and planting new small coffee plants in order to increase her crop output and meet greater demand. As a mother she plans to offer her children a better education, a better lifestyle, and a solid inheritance for the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Originally from Banteay Meanchey province, Yet is a young lady who strives for a living via rice farming. She has had this business for 10 years, earning about 2.5 USD per day. 

Yet wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Finance and Banking. So she is applying for her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to pay for tuition fees and to buy study supplies. She hopes that she can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to buy study supplies

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Ou Chrov Dristrict

loans.name: Phearin

texts.en:
Phearin is 29 years old and a married father blessed with two children: one schoolchild and one little child. The rest of his family is residing in Pursat Province’s Sampov Meas District. They rely on a business selling food including rice, Chinese noodles, porridge, Khmer noodles, etc. He has just been involved in this business for two years, and currently it returns to him about 23,000 riels (KHR) per day.

Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before, Phearin is seeking a first loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to renovate his food stall, buy more ingredients, and buy a decent motorbike to support his business. He hopes that he can support his business in time and get a good income.

loans.use: To renovate his food stall

loans.name: Maria Aracelis

texts.es:
La señora María Aracelis de 53 años, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace  10 años a la venta de productos alimenticios como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pastas de tomate, cajas de frescos, sopas instantáneas, etc.
Doña María Aracelis sus clientes son todos los amigos y vecinos que le llegan a comprar sus productos es una señora muy emprendedora y necesita el préstamo para la compra de frijoles, aguas, azúcar, refrescos, manteca, etc. para así tener un buen surtido y seguir trabajando ya que con cada crédito que se le ha tramitado a podido mejorar mas su negocio.
Doña  María Aracelis su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2013.
texts.en:
María Aracelis is 53 years old and lives with her husband in a San Lorenzo neighborhood in southern Honduras.  She has been selling food products such as rice, beans, lard, eggs, tomato paste, soft drinks, instant soup, etc. for the past 10 years.

María Aracelis’ customers are her friends and neighbors who arrive to buy her products.  She is a very enterprising woman and needs this loan to buy beans, water, sugar, soft drinks, lard, etc., so that she can have a good selection and be able to continue working.  Each loan has helped her improve her business.

María Aracelis’ dream is to expand her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Samneang's Group

texts.en:
Samneang is 45 years old and married. She strives for a living via a cassava farming business which she has been involved in for 15 years. 

This is the second micro-loan for Samneang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and Samneang is a group leader. The past loan, that she has fully repaid, helped her to improve her living conditions. 

For this cycle, she and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,200,000 KHR, while a remaining member is applying for 600,000 KHR. Samneang will spend her loan portion to pay for weeding fees, labor and shipping costs. She hopes that she can make more income and expand her business to a larger scale.

loans.use: to pay for weeding fees, labor and shipping costs

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en: A mother of three schoolchildren, residing in Pursat Province, Kunthea is a local who deals with the daily cost of living by farming rice, cassava and peanuts. It is a business that she has had for 12 years. This is a second loan for Kunthea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely, and it helped her with timely support for her agribusiness. For this cycle, she teamed up as a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer to boost her crop output. She highly believes that she can make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer to boost her crop output

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is 51 years old and a married mother, blessed with three children. To support her living, she grows rice on two hectares. This is the main source of income. The business has returned almost 3 USD per day. 

This is not the first loan for Ry with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid with success, have enabled her to improve her living conditions. 

For this cycle, she is seeking an education loan in order to pay the school fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree specializing in Accounting. She hopes that her daughter will get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the school fee for her daughter

loans.name: Alejandro Antonio

texts.es:
Alejandro de 64 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, empleado  de la Alcaldía Municipal de desde hace 20 años, por motivos familiares solo realizo estudios de educación básica; en ese tiempo de estudiante conoció a su esposa quien se dedica a la docencia, gracias al apoyo  que él le brindo para terminar su profesión.  Junto  a ella procrearon  3 hijos de los cuales  2 viven actualmente con ellos  y  una  vive en los estados unidos 

Él se dedica a trabajar  en la alcaldía, en el área de mantenimiento y  limpieza, además de cualquier otra actividad que se le encomiende, siempre trata de realizar sus actividades diligentemente  y ser un hombre cumplidor en su trabajo  así como  en su familia. 

El préstamo  será utilizado,  para realizar el pago de una parte de los derechos  de graduación de su hijo  menor, a quien  con grandes esfuerzos de él  y su esposa han apoyado para que culmine sus estudios superiores en ingeniería de sistemas informáticos, la otra parte de los derechos de graduación le apoyará su hermana  que está en los estados  unidos.  

En el futuro planea jubilarse, casi  al mismo tiempo que su esposa  y piensa en establecer  una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación,  con el fin de seguir generando  ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
64-year-old Alejandro is a very hard working man and has been employed by the local council for 20 years. For family reasons he was only able to complete his basic education. In his time at school he met his wife, who works as a teacher thanks to the support he gave her so she could complete her professional training. Together they have 3 children, 2 of whom live with them currently and a daughter who lives in the United States.

Alejandro works for the council in cleaning and maintenance as well as any other duties which he is given. He always tries to carry out his duties diligently and to be a reliable person at work as well as for his family.

The loan will be used to pay for part of his younger son's graduation fees. Alejandro and his wife have gone to great efforts to support their son in completing his studies in information systems engineering. The other part of the fees will be paid by the sister who lives in the United States.

In the future Alejandro has plans to retire around the same time as his wife and he is thinking about setting up a small shop in his home, with the aim of continuing to provide an income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for part of his younger son's graduation fees, in information systems engineering.

loans.name: Catiuska Del Pilar

texts.es:
Catiuska tiene 19 años de edad, trabaja como secretaria en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante y apoyar a su familia con los gastos; Catiuska cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque quiere salir adelante.

Catiuska está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar abarrotes para su hogar como atun, menestras, entre otros con lo cual podrá ahorrar ya que comprara los productos al por mayor, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Catiuska is 19 years old, she works as a secretary for a small company in her city, and her income helps her to get ahead in life and to support her family with the house expenses. Catiuska believes that things are going well with her job because she is responsible and above all, because she wishes to succeed.

Catiuska is very thankful with Kiva Lenders because thanks to the loan, she will be able to buy wholesale groceries for her home -like tuna and dry vegetables- and buying at wholesale prices will allow her to continue to save towards her big dream: study to obtain a University degree.

loans.use: to buy wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora de 33 años de edad, casada con un grado de educación de primaria completo cursado con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio apoyada por sus padres a pesar de las diferentes dificultades en ese tiempo. Junto a su pareja tienen 5 hijos los cuales están en diferentes grados de educación en la primaria y en familia se dedican a la agricultura en lo que es la siembra y cultivo de café. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad en su juventud ya que es un rubro beneficioso el cual ha traído muchas bendiciones para su familia por generaciones por lo que ella agradece a DIOS por hoy en día hacerlo y seguirse beneficiando del mismo rubro. La tierra que trabajan una parte fue herencia de sus padres y la otra parte fue comprada por medio de las ganancias en cosechas anteriores ubicadas a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan en vestía.
Hoy en día Sandra ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas para sus cultivos de café y darles el mantenimiento y protección necesaria para poder obtener una buena y provechosa cosecha.
Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar para poder cubrir los estudios de sus hijos, sus alimentos entre otras necesidades que son necesarias atender para el desarrollo en la vida.
texts.en:
Sandra is a very enterprising and hardworking 33 year old woman.  She’s married and has an elementary school education, which she completed in with lots of effort and sacrifice and support from her parents, despite the difficulties of that time.  She and her husband have five children in different elementary school grades.  The family farms coffee.  It was her parents who taught her this when she was young because this is a beneficial trade that has provided good benefits for the family for generations and she is thankful to God because it continues to do so.  Her parents gave her part of the land that they work.  They bought another part, located 2 km from their home.  They travel there on an animal.

Sandra is asking for a loan, through the COMIXMUL cooperative so she can buy fertilizer, compost, and plant disease medication, for her coffee crops, to maintain and protect them and have a good harvest. 

Her plans for the future are to expand her coffee plantation and produce more income that will help cover the cost of her children’s education, food, and other necessities of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Silberia

texts.es:
Doña Silberia tiene una edad de 56 años es agricultora y ama de casa madre de una sola hija la cual ayuda con las diferentes actividades que se realizan en el campo siendo ella, el único apoyo para su madre y la más involucrada en las diferentes actividades del campo. Ella es madre soltera y no tiene ningún grado de educación por lo que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarla en su juventud. Sus ingresos económicos dependen del rubro del café por lo que diariamente en compañía de su hijo trabajan fuertemente para poder generar ingresos para la sostenibilidad familiar. La tierra que ellas trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 4 kilómetros de distancia a la cual se trasladan caminando para asistirla. Sus clientes son intermediarios, bodegas, pulperías, familiares y amigos que viven en la zona o llegan a la misma para para la adquisición de su producto.
Por lo que ella hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara abono, urea, fertilizantes entre otros para proteger y abonar sus cultivos de café ya que de esa forma ella podrá dar una mejor asistencia a sus cultivos.
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder cultivar café ya que la tierra que ella tiene es propia y apta por su clima localidad y mantenimiento para el mismo. Sus sueños son los de poder asegurar la construcción de su casa rehaciendo una parte de bloque que es necesaria y seguir fortaleciendo el patrimonio para su hija.
texts.en:
Silberia, 56, is a farmer and housewife with just one daughter who helps her with the various farming tasks. She is her mother's only help and does most of the farming tasks. Silberia is a single mother and has had no education as her parents had limited means and were unable to support her when she was growing up.

Silberia's income depends on coffee and so she and her daughter work hard every day in order to make enough income to support the family. The land they work on is their own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents. The land is 4 km away and they walk there. Their customers are middle men, warehouses, grocery stores, family members and friends who live in the area or who visit to buy the coffee.

So Silberia is now asking for a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative which she will use to buy manure, urea, fertilizers and other items to protect and feed her coffee plants as this will enable her to tend her crops better.

In the future she plans to carry on growing coffee since the land she has is her own and is ideal for growing coffee because of its climate, location and ease of maintenance. Her dreams are to be able to make the construction of her house more secure, redoing a part of the blockwork which needs doing and to continue to build up her assets for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing her coffee.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
One of the breadwinners in a family consisting of seven children, Yi is 54 years old and a resident of the province of Takeo. To tackle the primary basic needs of the family, she does rice farming with support from her husband. She has been occupied with this business for ages, and it has returned to her almost $2.50 US per day.

Yi has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages. The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her to uplift her living conditions. Conditions are now better than before, and she has fully repaid the entire past loan already. Now she wants to pay attention to her son’s education, as her son wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in finance and banking. Therefore, she needs a new loan to pay for school fees for her son. She hopes that her son will get a good score in his study performance and get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay for school fees for her son

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 20 años de edad cuya vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad con un clima muy cálido y con atractivos turísticos muy hermosos. Miguel es padre de un pequeño de 2 años y junto con su pareja se esfuerzan mucho para poder brindarle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y sobre todo mucho amor. 

Dia a día Miguel trabaja como jardinero en una empresa agrícola de la zona, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo realiza su trabajo con mucho cuidado y honradez.
