Miguel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya es la segunda vez que le dan su ayuda y en esta oportunidad podrá comprar una moto para poder movilizarse a su centro de labores y poder ahorrar en movilidad y así seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 20, lives in the city of Chincha.  The city has a very warm climate and many very beautiful tourist attractions.  Miguel has a little two year old.  Together, he and his life partner put forth a lot of effort in order to be able to give their son a good quality of life, and, most of all, a lot of love.

Miguel works day to day as a gardener for an agricultural company in the area.  He works around nine hours a day.  He believes that it is going well for him in his work because he is very responsible.  Above all, he does his work with great care and honesty.

Miguel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  This is the second time they have given him their help.  He will now be able to buy a motorcycle in order to be able to get to his work center.  He will also be able to save on transportation.  This way he will continue struggling in order to make his biggest dream a reality.  His dream is to have his own house and to give his son a good education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: A citizen from Moung Russey, Sopheap is 26 years old and the married father of two children. The rest of his family counts on his rice farming on a three-hectare area with support from his wife. He has been involved in this business for several years and it has returned about 40,000 KHR per day to him. This is the third loan for Sopheap with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has utilized his past loans wisely and he has managed to upgrade his living conditions to better than before. For this cycle, in a group of two, he is the leader. For Sopheap, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and herbicide for his farmland. He hopes that he can boost his crop yield better than before so that he can gain a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicide for his farmland

loans.name: Ana Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Ana es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos pan y churros desde hace 3 años.
Doña Ana tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser refresco, pan, churros, galletas, frijoles, arroz, azúcar y agua productos que necesita para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Doña Ana espera que el préstamo la ayude ya que gracias a el contara con el producto suficiente para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, además espera un aumento en las ventas con el cual ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. 
Doña Ana espera que su negocio crezca y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Ana is a very hard-working and honest person who lives with her husband and their 2 children in a community in southern Honduras. Her business for the last 3 years has been selling soft drinks, bread, and fried bread sticks. Ana's business is located in her residence and the customers are her friends and neighbors in the community.

She is soliciting a loan to buy more products, such as soft drinks, bread, fried bread sticks, cookies, beans, rice, sugar, and water, needed to cover customer demand. Ana hopes that the loan will help her since she will have sufficient products to satisfy customer requests. In addition she hopes that increased sales will bring more income that can benefit her family's style of life at home.

Ana hopes her business will grow and continue to help her children in their studies.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, fried bread sticks, cookies, beans, rice, sugar, and water for her business.

loans.name: Jane Rosaly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jane Rosaly works hard to support her family. She has a handicraft business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Jane Rosaly is borrowing 11,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more raw materials to be used in her handicraft business.

Jane Rosaly has been sustaining her business activities with her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials to be used in her business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 37-year-old married man. He describes himself to be serious. 

He operates a general shop where he sells sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a market area and his primary customers are individual consumers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to add stock of sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and other household items. 

His business goal is to open a mini supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will create employment. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, and other household items

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 42-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 to 24 years old. She describes herself to be humble and trustworthy. She operates a poultry farm where she keeps poultry to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are institutions, individuals and groups. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a low supply of poultry. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add to her stock of poultry. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be sincere. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, cooking oil, washing soap, bread etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy stock of bread, sugar, washing soap, cooking fat and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, washing soap, cooking fat and other items to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be innovative. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, onions, and kale. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to add stock of tomatoes, onions, kale, and other groceries. 

Her business goal is to have a big shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stock of tomatoes, onions, kale, and other groceries

loans.name: Douglas Javier

texts.es: Douglas Javier 29 años de edad soltero, originario de unos de los municipios de Chinandega zona ubicada al norte del país, se caracteriza por predominar el comercio de ganado, cerdos en pie, oro, comercio de diferentes mercaderías en general ya que es una zona fronteriza, Douglas se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, asi como frijoles, maíz entre otros el realiza sus compras a distribuidores de granos básicos que le surten dos veces a la semana y a productores de la zona compra al contado sus ventas las realiza en su domicilio por quintales y al detalle al contado y al crédito los que recupera semanal o quincenal, al igual se dedica a la compra venta de cerdos en comarcas aledañas y vende a los destazadores y comerciantes de la zona al contado y al crédito. El inicia su negocio con ahorros propios y uno de sus sueños es poder comprar su propia casa de habitación. El objetivo este crédito es para invertir en ambos negocios ya que su demanda ha crecido y necesita cubrir con sus pedidos.-
texts.en:
Douglas Javier is 29 years old, he is single and he is from Chinandega, a borderline region in the northern part of the country characterized by the trading of livestock, gold and merchandise in general. 

Douglas buys bulk grains from wholesale suppliers -like beans and corn- and he then sells them directly from his home to local producers who pay him either in cash or credit. Douglas collects the payments weekly or every two weeks.

In addition, Douglas also buys pigs from neighboring counties, and sells them to butchers and traders, who also buy from him either in cash or credit. 

Douglas began his business with personal savings, and one of his dreams is to own a house. The objective of this loan is to invest in both activities, given that demand is increasing and Douglas needs to be able to cover all of his customers’ orders.

loans.use: to invest in both activities: to buy pigs and to buy bulk grains like corn and beans.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, el cual es la venta de abarrotería en general realiza su trabajo desde hace 14 años y se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación, a sabido administrar su negocio y dice que con el amor a Dios todo puede salir bien.
Doña Gloria inicia su negocio por la falta de empleo en su comunidad y con la idea de salir adelante junto a su familia decide ser una empresaria en su comunidad, solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de mercadería como ser: azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, agua, frijoles, café, arroz, etc.
Doña Gloria sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención y carisma, su negocio es muy visitado y le gusta tener bien surtido, Gloria sueña con poder arreglar la fachada de enfrente de su casa y acondicionarla para ampliar el local y atender mejor a sus clientes, generándole esto mejores ventas y mejores ingresos para su familia.



Danlí, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Gloria is an enterprising woman who is works at her business selling general groceries. She has done this work for 14 years. It is located in her house. She has managed her business well and says that with God's love everything can come out alright. 

Gloria started her business because there were no jobs in her community and with the idea of getting ahead with her family, she decided to become a businesswoman in her community. She is asking for the help of a loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, lard, soap, beverages, water, beans, coffee, rice, etc. 

Gloria's customers prefer her because of her good service and charisma. Her business is much frequented and she likes to have a good selection. Gloria  dreams of being able to repair the facade of her house and remodel it so she can expand the locale and serve her customers better, thus generating better sales and income for her family. 



Danlí, Honduras – September,  2013

loans.use: to buy sugar, lard, soap, beverages, water, beans, coffee, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jimema

texts.en:
Jimema is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and earns more income from a general store. Jimema is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her business.

Jimema has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her bicycle transport business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with five children. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. Josephine has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, cream, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. 

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Ma. Lydia

texts.en:
Ma. Lydia works hard to support her family. Ma. Lydia is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Ma. Lydia requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more shells, nylon thread, etc. for her business.

Ma. Lydia has been in this business for 38 years now.

In the future, Ma. Lydia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more shells, nylon thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to his stock of building stones

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 32 years old and married with two children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, bath soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, bread, etc. to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

Marilyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, bath soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 59-year-old widowed woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 25 years to 36 years. She describes herself to be a go-getter. 

She operates a clothing store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of living. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of clothes for resale. 

Her business goal is to have many branches of clothing stores and create employment within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will create wealth. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of KES 100,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: add stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Monalisa has been in this business for 18 years now.

Monalisa requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Monalisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell for her ready-to-wear business. Porferia has been in this business for 14 years and has spent seven years in vehicle transport. Porferia earns additional income from vehicle transport. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Porferia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en: Mike is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 6 months to 12 years. He describes himself to be aggressive. He operates a farm where he sells cows, sheep and goats. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are both local and commercial. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough money for his business. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to purchase more cows and sheep for resale. His business goal is to alleviate the challenge of capital to run his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate and feed his family comfortably. His previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan and save the rest.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and sheep for resale

loans.name: Reisly

texts.en:
Reisly is 39 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Reisly has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Reisly requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business. 

Reisly has been in this business for 18 years. Reisly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and married with two children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, biscuits, hair conditioner, shampoo, laundry soap and other groceries to sell.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and earns additional income from sewing.

Rosalie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, biscuits, hair conditioner, shampoo, laundry soap and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 35 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell like rice, fabric conditioner, soft drinks, bread, canned goods, etc. in her general store.

Rosalina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, fabric conditioner, soft drinks, bread, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell like rice, fabric conditioner, soft drinks, bread, and canned goods

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia is a single woman. She describes herself to be aggressive. She operates a livestock business where she sells cows, sheep and goats. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are both local and commercial. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase more goats and cows for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her child. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and save the rest.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. Veronica is married and has a vegetable and spices vending business in the Philippines.

Veronica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vilma is 42 years old and has three children who are still in school. Vilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Vilma requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Wilson Zacarias

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Huacho con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Wilson pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de computación e informática.
Por iniciativa propia, Wilson trabaja en un centro de computo, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Wilson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará un pequeño ropero donde el y su familia almacenaran sus prendas de vestir evitando su deterioro y protegiéndolos de la humedad, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Wilson is 23 years old, single, and lives in the city of Huacho with his parents and siblings. He is hard working, enthusiastic, and dreams of success. Thanks to his hard work and the support of his parents, Wilson was able to study for a professional career in computing and information technology. On his own initiative, Wilson works in a center for computers. He works every day for around 10 hours and he thinks things are going well due to his dedication and hard work. 
Wilson is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva because it is thanks to their help that he will be able to purchase a small closet where he and his family can store their clothing items keep them from deteriorating while protecting them from the humidity. He will also continue working and pushing to achieve his greatest dream of all of being a successful professional.

loans.use: purchase a closet.

loans.name: Erika Yamileth

texts.es:
Doña Erika tiene 33 años de edad es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, muchos sueños para ella y su familia la cual está compuesta por dos hijos de los cuales una de ella ayuda en casa con los oficios domésticos y la menor en la primaria. Tiene 6 años de educación cursados y su pareja quien es apoyo incondicional también es agricultor siendo el quien más se involucra en las diferentes actividades del campo. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad dedicándose a este rubro por más de 20 años y hoy en día en compañía de su esposo. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona, vecinos y familiares. La tierra que trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia de sus padres la cual está ubicada a un kilómetro de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan caminando. 
Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, foliares entre otros que ayudaran a sus cultivos a estar más sanos y protegidos de plagas, bichos entre otros.
Sus metas es ser una de las mejores productoras de café entre otros de la zona atrayendo más clientes para su negocio y creciendo en variedad y calidad como también terminar de arreglar su casa de habitación la cual necesita mejoras como repello, el techo que está un poco deteriorado, etc. Sus sueños son los de poder ahorrar para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y lograr mandarlos a la universidad para que puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Erika is 33 years old. She is a woman with a lot of strength and dreams for herself and her family, made up of her and her two children. One of them helps her at home with the housework and the youngest is in primary school. She has 6 years of education and her spouse, who supports her unconditionally, is a farmer. He is the one who is the most involved in the farm activities. Her parents were the ones who taught her to work the land at a very young age, and she has been doing this kind of work for more than 20 years, now with her husband. Her customers are the different buyers who come to the area, residents and relatives. The land they work is their own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents. It is located  a kilometer away from her house, and they get there on foot. 

She has asked for a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to be able to buy fertilizers, foliar sprays, and more to help the crops be more healthy and protected from pests, bugs, disease and more. Her goals are to be one of the best coffee producers in the area, attracting more customers for her business and growing in variety and quality. She also wants to finish fixing her house, which needs work like re-plastering, fixing a deteriorated roof, etc. Her dreams are to be able to save to give her children a better quality of life and send them to college to study and have careers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, foliar sprays, urea and more to help with the coffee crops.

loans.name: Iris Marlena

texts.es: Iris, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ser ropa usada ya sea jeans, blusas, camisetas, shorts, ropa de niños etc. esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de ropa surtida como blusas, short, jeans, camisas etc. para la venta. Su objetivo es aumentar inventario con variedad de ropa y aumentar las ventas para mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia.
texts.en: Iris is 45 years old, a single mother of two children and lives in the municipality of San Marcos, Santa Barbara. For six years, she has been selling merchandise like used clothing such as jeans, blouses, shirts, shorts, children's clothing etc. She does this as a travelling saleswoman and by order. The loan she is applying for will be used to invest in purchasing more clothing like blouses, shorts, jeans, shirts etc to stock her business and to re-sell. Her objective is to increase her inventory with a variety of clothing and to increase sales so she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase clothing like blouses, shorts, jeans and shirts to re-sell.

loans.name: Berthalina

texts.es: Berthalina mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado al norte del país, es propietaria de una pulperia ofreciendo productos de consumo para el hogar como: café, aceite, huevos, pan, verduras , papel higienicos, golosinas, shampoo, ropa, entre otros ubicada en el área urbana de su domicilio ella realiza sus compras a camiones distribuidores y compra al contado sus ventas son al contado y al crédito en su domicilio también es propietaria de ganado de ordeño del que produce leche para vender ella entrega a clientes fijos, Berthalina se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, luchadora con deseos de superación personal, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su pulperia y surtirlos con diversos productos de consumo debido a que su demanda ha crecido y asi ofrecerles mejores y cómodos productos a sus clientes. Berthalina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Berthalina is married and she is a mother of two underage children. She is originally from the Chinandega region, in the western part of the country. 

Berthalina owns a home-based grocery store, where she sells basic consumer products such as coffee, oil, eggs, bread, vegetables, toilet paper, candy, shampoo, and clothes, among other. She buys these products from distributors, and she sells them to her customers either in cash or credit. She also owns dairy cattle and she delivers milk to her regular customers.

Berthalina is known for being a responsible woman, a hard worker and a person with a lot of will for personal development. The objective of this loan is to invest in her grocery store to buy a variety of products given that customer demand is increasing. In this way she will be able to offer good prices and good quality products to her customers. 

Berthalina is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low income individuals from poor countries like Nicaragua, which helps them to have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer products such as: rice, oil, beans, candy and clothes, among other.

loans.name: Yesenia Lucia

texts.es: Yessenia Lucia mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, zona ubicada en el occidente del país, es una microempresaria que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo como: aceite, maíz, huevos, pan, golosinas, detergentes, gas, fósforos, leche en bolsa, tomates, cebollas, chiltomas, maduros, ropa, cuadernos, productos congelados entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de mayoreos y camiones distribuidores entre otros, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su pulpería surtiéndola en diferentes productos de consumo que su demanda están solicitando y no posee en grandes cantidades para cubrir las necesidades de los clientes, Yessenia agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos en el país
texts.en: Yessenia Lucia is an older adult, married with two minor children, originally from one of the municipalities of Chinandega located in the western area of the country. She is a small business owner with a grocery store in her home that offers consumer products such as cooking oil, corn, eggs, bread, candy, detergents, gas, matches, bags of milk, tomatoes, onions, bell peppers, plantains, clothing, notebooks, frozen goods, among many others. She does her shopping in cash in wholesale markets and through distributors who deliver by truck among others. Her sales are through cash and credit. She has permanent and temporary clients. The goal for this loan is to invest in her store, stocking it with different consumer products that are in demand and lacking in sufficient supply to meet the needs of customers. Yessenia very much appreciates the support Kiva investors are offering to low-income people in her country.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with rice, cooking oil, beans, frozen goods, and candy among other products.

loans.name: 1 De Mayo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito 1 de Mayo está conformado por 11 mujeres quienes viven por la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, esta lugar es de un clima frió y  cuenta muchos potreros que son propicios para la crianza de ganado, sus terrenos son fértiles ideales para la agricultura. Su gente aun mantiene viva su cultura y tradiciones, son amables, gentiles y siempre tratan de ayudar a su prójimo, su principal actividad economía es la crianza de animales, agricultura y comercio, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Flora, desde hace algún tiempo forma parte del grupo de crédito 1 de Mayo, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque les ayuda en el crecimiento de sus negocios al mismo tiempo que fortalecen los lasos de su amistad.
La Señora Flora tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 17 y 16 años que están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en un taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señora Flora pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la costura, esta actividad la aprendió trabajando y por habilidad, ahora cuenta con su propio negocio desde hace 3 años y le va bien ya que poco a poco ha obtenido clientela. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a  invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y otros materiales de costura. 
Su meta es agrandar su taller.
texts.en:
The group 1 of May is made up of 11 women who live in the parish of Victoria del Portente in the town of Cuenca. It is a place with a cool climate and is known for its cowboys who care for the cattle.  The terrain here is fertile and ideal for agriculture. The people here have maintained their culture and traditions, they are friendly, gentle and always trying to help one another. Their principal economic activity is caring for animals, agriculture and trade. Many work in the city doing various different jobs as well. 
One of the members of this group is Mrs. Flora who has been a member for quite some time. She likes micro credits because they help her to grow her business while also strengthening her friendships with those she works with. 
Mrs. Flora is 34 years old, married, and has two children who are 17 and 16, who study at the high school in her town. Her husband is a professional driver and provides a taxi service. They do not have their own home and so they live in a rented house. 
Mrs. Flora spends most of her time at home but she also contributes to the family purse by sewing. She learned how to sew through experience and because she has a talent for it. She has been running her own business for around 3 years and everything is going well because little by little her clientele is growing. The money from this loan will be used to invest in the purchase of cloth, thread and other sewing supplies. 
He goal is to expand her workshop.

loans.use: purchase material, thread and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Raquel Jamilett

texts.es:
Raquel Jamilett es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es una joven de 25 años, casada, madre de dos niñas que se gana la vida laborando como maestra de primaria.
A pesar de tener muchas dificultades para cumplir con su trabajo como tener que recorrer 20 km en bicicleta, cruzar una quebrada en temporada de invierno para asistir a la escuela de la comarca La Montañita esta joven ejerce su profesión con entusiasmo y dedicación, ya que eligió esta carrera porque le gusta enseñar a leer y escribir sobre todo a los niños de escasos recursos.
Se dio cuenta que hay unos inversionistas en el extranjero llamado Kiva que apoyan con créditos a través de Ceprodel a personas de escasos recursos, por tal motivo se presentó por primera vez a la oficina para solicitar un crédito, ya que en este momento lo necesita para pagar la operación de su cuñada que se vio mal en el parto con el fin de salvar la vida de ella y su bebé.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón aprueben su solicitud que tanto la necesita.
texts.en:
Raquel Jamilett is from the municipality of El Sauce. She is a young woman of 25, married and the mother of two daughters, who earns a living working as a primary school teacher.

In spite of having many difficulties in carrying out her work, such as having to travel 20 km by bicycle and having to cross a stream in the rainy season to attend the area's school in La Montañita, this young woman practices her profession with enthusiasm and dedication. She chose this career because she likes to teach reading and writing, especially to low-income children. 

She realized that there are lenders in foreign countries through the organization called Kiva who help low-income people with loans through Ceprodel. For this reason she came to the office for the first time to request a loan, as at this time she needs it to pay for her sister-in-law's operation. Her sister-in-law  had a difficult childbirth in saving her life and that of her baby. She hopes and trusts in God that these people with good hearts will approve her request for a loan which she so much needs.

loans.use: To pay for an operation for her brother's wife.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio es un hombre de 66 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus 6 hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Emilio no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Emilio se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra plátano y maíz, en ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Emilio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de de riego, abono y cosecha de su cultivo, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Emilio is a 66-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and their six children. He is hardworking, enthusiastic, and dedicated to all his efforts to raise his family. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and his need to begin work at a very young age, Emilio could not pursue a professional career. 
On his own initiative, Emilio works in agriculture. He has a small plot on which he plants bananas and corn. He works everyday for about 8 hours and believes he is doing well for his dedication and efforts. 
Emilio is very grateful to Kiva lenders and thanks them for their help to cover the costs of irrigation, fertilizer, and crop cultivation. He will continue to work and strive to achieve his dream of expanding his crops.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs for his crops.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as jolly. She operates a grocery where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to add more stock. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more bananas to sell. Her business goal is to own several stores for selling bananas within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will meet customer demand. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Marisela Yamileth

texts.es:
Marisela de 25 años, estudio hasta bachillerato general, es madre soltera de un hijo que aún no asiste a la escuela; ellos viven con la mamá  y  un hermano.   

Ella se dedica a la venta de tostadas, turrones, yuca, dulces, churros de todo tipo; además vende ropa y productos de cosméticos por catálogo, siempre ha tenido el mismo negocio.  La casa de ella, esta como a diez metros del negocio de ella, se traslada a pie y trabaja de lunes a domingo de ocho y treinta de la mañana a una y treinta de la tarde

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para cancelar una deuda con otra institución, ya que el interés es muy caro e invertirá en inventario, el cual pretende obtener mejores ganancias; ya que ahorrara y aumentara su inventario por lo que le podrá dar un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Marisela, 25, is a high school graduate and single mother of a son not yet attending school. They live with her mother and brother. 

She sells tostadas, nougat candy, yucca, sweets, and churros of all kinds. She also sells clothing and cosmetics products by catalog. She has always had the same business. Her home is located about ten meters from where she conducts her business. She walks to work and works Monday through Sunday from 8:30 in the morning to 1:30 in the afternoon.

The loan she is requesting is for paying off a debt with another institution since the interest is very expensive and for investing in inventory through which she aims to achieve better profits, save money, and increase her stock so that she can give a better future to her son.

loans.use: to pay off debt to another institution.

loans.name: Juan Lorenzo

texts.es: Juan, tiene 43 años de edad, está soltero, tiene dos hijas, y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la compra y venta de mercadería. Hace 1 año  que ofrece servicios de transporte para personas en moto taxi. El préstamo que solicito es por 7,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en hacer un abono al crédito que tiene con la distribuidora de moto taxis, ya que su moto la obtuvo al crédito. Con este abono va poder salir pronto de la deuda y va tener un ahorro. Su sueño es estar solvente y poder darle un mejor estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 years old, single and has two daughters. He lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Previously, he worked buying and selling merchandise. 

For the last year he has been providing passenger service with his mototaxi. The loan he has requested is for 7000 lempiras, and he is going to use it to pay down the loan he has with the mototaxi distributorship, as he obtained his mototaxi on credit. With this payment he is going to be able to pay off his debt soon and will have savings. His dream is to be solvent and be able to provide a better education to his daughters.

loans.use: To pay down the loan he has with the mototaxi distributorship, as he obtained his mototaxi on credit.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a widowed woman. She has 5 children whose ages range from 12 years to 24 years. She describes herself as honest. Ann operates a cereals store where she sells maize, beans, millet and rice, and she has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are schools and retailers. 

Ann describes her biggest business challenge as expensive transportation. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of rice. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will make her family happy. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice

loans.name: Yamilit Noemi

texts.es:
Yamilit tiene 21 años de edad, para poder llevar un sustento a su hogar trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de su ciudad, asimismo con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para solventar sus gastos; Yamilit cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy carismática y sobre todo porque le gusta mucho la cocina.

Yamilit está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando podrá comprar mercadería como polos, short, bividis, entre otros, con lo cual podrá atender los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Yamilit is 21-years-old. In order to create a livelihood, she is working as a kitchen helper in a restaurant in her city as well as putting in great effort in starting her business selling clothes, which provides extra money to support herself. Yamilit believes that she is doing well in this job because she is very charismatic and especially because she loves cooking. 

Yamilit is very grateful to Kiva lenders and thanks to they help they are providing she can buy merchandise like polo shirts, shorts, undershirts, as well as others so that she can meet orders she has from her customers and improve her income and keep fighting to be able to realize her dream of building a house.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as polo shirts, shorts, and other clothing.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana vive en la comunidad de Huayllabamba en el distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de harina. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de harina, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. El cliente pertenece al banco comunal “Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba”  y sus reuniones son cada treinta días en la casa de uno de los clientes.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the Huayllabamba community in the Huancarani district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.  Her main business activity is selling flour.

She now needs a loan to buy sacks of flour.  She is grateful for and values the loan.  She pledges to make her monthly payments very responsibly.  She belongs to the Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba communal bank.  Their meetings are every 30 days in a member’s house.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita works hard to support her family. Virginita is married and has a vegetable and spice vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell.  She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Virginita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Zikirillo

texts.ru: Зикирилло позитивный и очень активный мужчина в возрасте 41 года. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Со своей семьёй Зикирилло живёт в горной местности, почти возле гор. Он очень любит природу, и большую часть своего времени он проводит на природе. Также он очень любит животных. С малых лет он помогал отцу выращивать и пасти скот. И на сегодняшний день он является опытным скотоводом. Зикирилло  начиная с 2012 года сотрудничает с Арванд. Он получал кредит, чтобы начать свой бизнес и по сей день продолжает расширять свой бизнес. Он занимается животноводством. Занимаясь этим видом деятельности хочет  принести дополнительный доход в свою семью. В настоящее время Зикирилло  хочет  купит бычков, чтобы ухаживать, откармливать  и продавать  на местном рынке. Для этого он обратился в Арванд в очередной раз и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Зикрилло и его семья очень благодарны  за поддержку, и они надеются на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Zikirillo is a positive and very active man of the age of 41. He is married and has four children. Zikirillo lives in the highlands together with his family, near the mountains. He loves nature very much, and the main part of his time he spends in nature. He also likes animals very much. Since his younger years, he helped his father breed and feed livestock. Currently he is an experienced livestock breeder. 

Beginning in 2012, Zikirillo cooperates with Arvand. He received a loan in order to start a business, and to this day he continues to expand it. He works with livestock breeding. He would like to bring an additional income to his family through working with this type of business. 

Currently Zikirillo would like to purchase steers, in order to care for, fatten and resell them at the local market. For this he turned to Arvand once again, and would like to receive a loan to purchase livestock. Zikirillo and his family is very grateful for the support and they hope for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to purchase steers

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria de Jesús, tiene 29 años de edad, esta soltera y vive junto a su madre en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura junto a su padre. Hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de mercadería camisas, pantalones, blusas, cosméticos, cremas, lociones, etc. las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. El prestamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mercadería como cosméticos, ropa, cremas, lociones y productos de belleza, para surtir mas el negocio y asi poder tener una mejor ganancia ya que aumentaran las ventas. Su plan es mejorar el negocio e incrementarlo cada vez más.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesús is 29 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in the Morazán municipality in Yoro.  She previously worked in agriculture with her father.  She has been selling merchandise like shirts, pants, blouses, cosmetics, creams, and lotions, etc. for two years.  She sells in an itinerant manner.

She is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like cosmetics, clothes, creams, lotions, and beauty supplies to stock her business more.  This way she will be able to have better profits because her sales will increase.  Her plan is to improve her business and increase it more and more.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cosmetics, clothes, creams, lotions, and beauty supplies to stock her business more.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: El Sr. Fermín tiene 49 años,  casado con tres hijos d las edades de 18, 16 y 14 años,  el es artesano en Plantas de Totora, es una planta muy resistente que tiene mucho trabajo manual para poder usarlo,   el vive en la comunidad de Chilaya Grande, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  sus artesanías  de totoras como sillas, adornos, balzas, etc. la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Fermin va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de su casa y también para la compra e totora para realizar su trabajo y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, el Sr. Fermín enfrenta retos en su negocio que son a veces la falta de material para realizar sus artesanías, El Sr. Fermin es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantenerse.
texts.en: Fermín is 49-years-old and married with three children the ages 18, 16, and 14. He is an artisan who uses large reeds, a very hardy plant that requires much manual labor to use it. He lives in the community of Chilaya Grande, the touristic center of the Department of La Paz where he offers the public his reed craftwork such as chairs, ornaments, etc. The majority of the inhabitants of the island make a living through fishing and tourism. This loan is his first from this institution. Fermín is going to use the loan for the purchase of construction material for the construction of his house and also for the purchase of reeds to do his work and satisfy the demands of his clients. Fermín confronts challenges in his business that are sometimes due to the lack of materials for his handicrafts. Fermín is a person with the desire to excel. He is happy and grateful to the institution for its support since this is the only income he has to support himself.

loans.use: to purchase construction material and materials for his craftwork.

loans.name: Rosamilda

texts.es: La Sra. Rosamilda  sigue con la actividad de la elaboración y venta de pan cuenta que le va muy bien,  el anterior crédito lo utilizo en la compra de compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan como azúcar y harina, por mayor,  creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de un horno de mayor capacidad  para la elaboración de pan y empanadas, por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Rosamilda has continued with her business preparing and selling bread. She reports that her business is doing well. She used the previous loan to purchase supplies in bulk, such as sugar and flour, to make bread. Her business has grown and has gained more customers. Her income has also increased. 

She is now requesting a loan to purchase a higher-capacity oven to make bread and empanadas in bulk. She is happy and thankful to have this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a higher-capacity oven.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is married, with three children, their ages ranging from 18 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a butchery where she sells meat. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She also does farming to earn extra income.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to add stocks of meat for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy family and expand business.

loans.use: add stocks of meat for resale

loans.name: It

texts.en:
It, who is aged 38, is a hard-working woman, married with a school-aged child. 

She owns and manages a rice farming business in Prey Veng province. Despite taking care of her family, she also runs a small business from her village, selling Khmer noodles with soup to serve breakfast for the surrounding people. From this, she is able to make a net profit of $2 per day to add to her husband’s income from providing hair-dressing services down the street.

It would like to improve her living conditions and make life more comfortable by having clean energy like solar to use in her household. Due to insufficient fund, she has applied for a loan of US$ 500 US dollars to buy a system for a solar home. This purchase will enable them to gain access to electricity of Solar, which provides power to home devices such as lights, TV, and radio. 

She thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a system for a solar home

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean is a resident living in a peaceful village of the Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She devotes herself to a business of making and selling a kind of Khmer cakes. She is now 53 years old, a widow with no children. She relies on herself to generate income and to stabilize her living. However, the income from her business is barely enough to cover her daily costs.

At the moment, she has requested a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to pay labor costs incurred in fixing her kitchen. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy ingredients for making her cakes, such as rice and soybean. 

She is very thankful for the loan support, which will allow her to increase her sales and thereby make additional income.

loans.use: to pay labor costs incurred in fixing her kitchen.

loans.name: Chroek

texts.en:
Chroek is 55 years old and married, originally from Ponhea Lueu district, Kandal province. 

To earn a livelihood, she rents a small space in a local market for selling fresh fish she buys from the suppliers. She has been in this business for almost three years, earning about US$ 6 per day. She aims to increase her sales and doubles her income in order to satisfy her living needs and place her school-aged children in a good university after their graduation.

As of now, she is taking out a loan in the amount of US $1,200 to make some home improvements, as her home has deteriorated over the years. And she also will use another portion of the loan to invest in her fish-selling business. 

She believes that, through the loan help, she will provide her family members with a comfortable life style.

loans.use: to make some home improvements, as her home has deteriorated over the years.

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en:
Tuon is 27 years old and married with a small child, whom she aims to enroll to school soon. 

She is employed as a garment worker specialized in sewing clothes and has a normal salary range from US $70 to $100 per month, including overtime benefits.  Their main source of income is from her husband, who is a truck driver. Tuon and her husband are seeking other ways that might allow them to generate additional income.

Tuon has been a client with HKL for two cycle loans already.  Now she has come to HKL office for another loan opportunity to invest in a taxi business. She has applied for a loan of US$ 1,500 to supplement their savings in buying a car for her husband to provide transportation from Phnom Penh to the provinces and the provinces back to Phnom Penh.

This initiative investment would make a great change in their income, and they hope to achieve economic stability and experience a better quality of life someday.

loans.use: to help buy a car for her husband to start a taxi Phnom Penh to the provinces and the provinces back to Phnom Penh.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle for her vehicle transport business.

Virginia has been in this business for 8 years. Virginia earns additional income from raising pigs.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn, aged 41 years old, is married, with seven children. 

She owns and manages a farming business in Kampong Thom province and also raises pigs in the backyard of her home for additional income; her husband is involved in making palm sugar to sell. They cooperate well and always help each other in each business because they have the same goal of lifting their family out of the poverty. 

Due to lack of capital for the process of making palm sugar, Khorn would like to borrow a loan of KHR 2,200,000 to buy chopped wood for cooking sugar. With the remaining balance, she will buy a long bamboo ladder, which will be used to place against palm trees for collecting juice. 

She believes that she will be able to make additional income through this investment. She awaits for your kind support and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy chopped wood for cooking palm sugar and a ladder to collect palm juice

loans.name: Porn

texts.en:
Porn is 40 years old and married, the mother of three children.  One has settled into marriage already, so only two still depend on her income. She and her husband are raising their family in a village of Kampong Thom province. 

To make a livelihood, she is dedicated to a pig-fattening business from her own home. She has been doing this for more than 10 years.

To help her sustain her business, she has applied for a loan of KHR 6,000,000 to buy more pigs and feed enough to provide enough nutrition for her pigs. 

She believes that this loan will enable her to work out her plans, and she hopes that she will have a good profit when she sells her fattened pigs into the markets.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed to provide enough nutrition for her pigs.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang is a responsible mother who aims to uplift her family's standard of living. She is 53 years old, and has five children. 

Kang owns a few pieces of land in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province; she uses it for rice cultivation. She has learned to do this from older people and her parents, and has been this for ages. Her husband always helps her manage this business, and also devotes himself to providing horse-transportation services for more income.

At the moment, she would like to acquire a loan of KHR 6,000,000 to buy a young horse for her husband providing transportation services. And she will also use a portion of the loan to buy a water pump for carrying the water into or out of her field. She believes that through this loan, she will be able to make her family-owned business more achievable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a young horse for her husband providing transportation services.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut is 27 years old and married, with a school-age child. She aims to improve her family's standad of living and experience a better quality of life. 

She engages in rice farming to generate income. She plans to improve her farm to increase her yields and satisfy her family's needs. She has been in this occupation for nearly four years, and usually earns a net profit of US$ 3 per day.

This is the first loan cycle for Khut.  She has applied for her husband’s sake because he needs a motorcycle for commuting to work. She says that the loan will enable her husband to save more money and travel to his construction site on time. 

She is very grateful for your kind support and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband commuting to his workplace.

loans.name: Neyda Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Eloy Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Neyda, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  14, 8 y 2 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Nayda con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto solventar ciertos gastos de los estudios de sus hijos hace mas de 10 años empezó un pequeño negocio en su casa el mismo que con el paso de los días y con la ayuda de los créditos ha ido mejorando, ella tiene una heladería en su casa donde vende helados de una marca nacional muy reconocida, también vende gaseosas, aguas, jugos energizantes y varias bebidas, los días que más vende son los fines de semana que es cuando se reúnen  sus clientes a jugar por unas canchas que están frente a su casa.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que así como siempre ella financia su negocio y sus ganancias le sirvieron para ciertos gastos de medicinas que tuvo pues uno de sus hijos estuvo enfermo y parte de sus ganancias las tenia reunida y le sirvieron para esa emergencia el resto lo volvió a invertir en su negocio. Este crédito es para comprar helado, gaseosas, aguas, entre otros productos que vende. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora cada vez más  su negocio. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
BANCO COMUNAL ELOY ALFARO (individual)
texts.en:
The "Eloy Alfaro" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi area which is known for its rich, precolonial culture and its artisan crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.It is from here that straw hats originate.

And it is here that Neyda lives. She is 35 years old, married and has three children - aged fourteen, eight, and two years old each. The two eldest children are in school. Neyda's husband is a construction worker.

In order to earn a little on her own and to cover the costs of her children's education, Neyda started her own little business ten years ago. 

She runs it out of her home and as the days have gone by and with the help of loans, the business has improved. Neyda's business is an ice cream shop. 

She sells a very well-known, national brand of ice cream, in addition to fizzy drinks, water, juices, energy drinks and other beverages. 

She makes most of her sales on the weekend as many people in the area meet up at some courts in front of her house to play sports. 

She is asking for another loan as this is how she has always financed her business. Her profits served her for certain medical expenses since one of her children was sick. Part of her profits went to this emergency and the rest was invested back in the business. 

This loan is to buy ice cream, fizzy drinks, water and other products to sell. 

She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because the loans help her to keep on improving her business. Her dream is to give her children the best she possibly can.


ELOY ALFARO COMMUNAL BANK (individual)

loans.use: to buy ice-creams, fizzy drinks, water and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Shaken

texts.ru: Шакен 63 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает четверых детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Шакен - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шакен занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шакен, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 3 теленка, 15 овец, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шакен обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шакен планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Shaken is 63 years old and she is a widow.  After the death of her husband, she raised four children and ran the household by herself.  Shaken has a high school education and as the main source of income for her family she raises livestock, which she started doing 25 years ago with the purchase of animals for 1,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Shaken now has five dairy cows, three calves, 15 sheep and one horse on her farm.  Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Shaken has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls to increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock, and she plans on saving up money to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia,es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar,viven en casa propia ocupando cinco habitaciones,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la población de Palomar de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día en su tienda de barrio y los fines de semana se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo durante todo el día,ya que deben cubrir los gastos de alimentación,educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia ,también su esposo trabaja como albañil realizando algunas refacciones y construcciones.
El credito lo requiere para la compra de semilla mejorada de flores y vegetales ya que le sera de mucha ayuda por que la misma no necesita de tanto riego,la tierra no se desgasta tanto y su producción es bastante rápida. de esta forma mejoraran sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Delia es aumentar su producción y también dedicarse al ganado por completo ya que de las otras actividades no obtienen mucha ganancia.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Delia is married and has two school-aged children.  They live in their own 5-room home in the Palomar neighborhood of La Paz.
Delia currently works over eight hours a day in her neighborhood store.  On the weekends, she and her husband work all day in agriculture.  They do this to help cover the costs of food, education and basic services for their family.  Her husband also works as a brick layer doing repair and new construction. 
They need the loan to purchase improved flower and vegetable seed.  It will be a big help to them, as this type of seed doesn't need as much watering, doesn't deplete the land as much and has a fast production.  They will then be able to improve their income as well as their quality of life. 
Delia's dream is to increase her agricultural production and also to make her living entirely in livestock, as the she doesn't get much profit from the other businesses. 
This is Delia's third loan with IMPRO and her third time working with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy improved flower and vegetables seeds.

loans.name: Mayde

texts.es:
Mayde, es soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar,viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar en el departamento de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica por completo a la agricultura ya que son los únicos ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia pagando los gastos de alimentación,educación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le sera de mucha ayuda en la producción de verduras por que esta semilla no necesita de mucho riego y la producción es mas rápida,de esta forma mejorara y aumentara sus ingresos.
El sueño de Mayde es producir en mas cantidad para mejorar su calidad de vida y brindar mas comodidad a su familia.
Es la qunta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Mayde is single and has two school-age children. They live in their own three-room house located in Palomar in La Paz department. She farms, which generates the only income she earns to provide food, education, and basic services for her family. She needs a loan to buy improved seed, which will greatly help her vegetable production because the seed needs little water and grows much faster. This will increase her income.

Mayde dreams of producing more so that her standard of living improves and her family is more comfortable. This is her fifth loan cycle with IMPRO and her third with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved vegetable seed.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia,es casada y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos ya son independientes y los otros dos viven con ella, en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra en la población del Palomar en la ciud de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja todo el día dedicándose a la agricultura y cría de ganado vacuno para poder mantener a su familia ya que su esposo trabaja en la ciudad y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le sera de mucha ayuda ya que no necesita de mucho riego y la producción es mas rápida y limpia, además de que el terreno no se desgasta mucho.
El sueño de Alicia, es mejorar su producción y sus ingresos económicos ya que eso le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Alicia is married and has four children, two of whom are independent and two live with her. They live in their own three-room house in Palomar in the city of La Paz. Every day she farms and raises cattle to support her family. Her husband works in the city, and her income has to pay for the family's food, education, and basic services.

She needs a loan to buy improved vegetable seed, which will be a great help because it requires little irrigation, grows fast and cleanly, and also conserves the soil. Alicia dreams of increasing production and income, which will improve her standard of living. This is her first loan cycle with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved vegetable seed so that her production is higher and cleaner.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben, es casado y solo viven con uno de sus hijos que esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones,la casa de ladrillo con pisos de tierra, la misma se encuentra en la población de Palomar en el departamento de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja junto a su esposa durante todo el día dedicándose a la siembra y cosecha de   verduras y a la criá de ganado vacuno.,y con los ingresos con los que cuenta debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le sera de mucha ayuda por que le ayuda a economizar agua ya que no necesita mucho riego y también produce en menos tiempo.
El sueño de Ruben es aumentar su producción de verduras y también de ganado para aumentar sus ingresos y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ruben is married and he lives with only one of his children who is school-aged. They live in their own home with three rooms. The house is made of bricks and has dirt floors, similar to what you find throughout the population of Palomar in the district of La Paz.

Currently, he works all day every day together with his wife planting and harvesting vegetables and raising beef cattle. They rely on their earnings to cover their expenses for food, education and basic services for their family. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy better seeds that will be helpful because they save water by requiring less water, and they produce crops within a shorter timespan. Ruben's dream is to increase his vegetable and cattle production and thereby increase his earnings so that he can improve his quality of life. This is the fourth time that he is seeking a loan through IMPRO and the second time through KIVA.

loans.use: to buy better seeds for the vegetables that he grows.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, es divorciado tiene una hija que esta en etapa escolar, vive en una hacienda como cuidador ocupando solo una habitación,la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar en el departamento de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja cuidando la hacienda durante el día y los fines de semana cultiva flores,el crédito lo requiere para la compra de semilla mejorada de acelga y choclo,ya que es de mucha ayuda por que no requiere de mucho riego y la producción es en menos tiempo, de esta forma podemos economizar el agua y cuidar el medio ambiente.
El sueño de Julio, es tener  terrenos mas grandes de siembra y cosecha para mejorar sus ingresos y poder apoyar a su hija en sus estudios,ya que actualmente con los pocos ingresos que tiene cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julio is divorced and has a daughter in school age. He works taking care of a farm, where he lives in a room. The house is located in the village of Palomar, La Paz department.

He takes care of the farm during the daytime and during the weekends, he grows flowers. He is requesting a loan to buy improved chard and corn seeds. These plants are easy to take care of, and require little water and less time to grow. By saving water it is possible to help taking care of the environment.

Julio’s dream is to acquire a larger piece of agricultural land and increase his income so that he can support his daughter with her studies. At the moment, he has to cover his family’s food, education and utilities expenses with a small income.

This is the fourth time he requests a loan to IMPRO and the second time working with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved chard and corn seeds for a cleaner production.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, es casada y tiene tres hijos los cuales todos estudian en colegio en nivel secundario,viven en casa propia ocupando seis habitaciones los cuales tienen las paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra,la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar en el departamento de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la producción de verduras y muy poco al ganado ya que con lo poco que gana con su producción y en la venta de su tienda de barrio debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos ya que su esposo no le ayuda por que trabaja en la ciudad .
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semilla mejorada de verduras ya que sera de mucha ayuda economizando su tiempo por que esta no requiere de mucho riego y su producción es mas rápida y el terreno se desgasta menos, cuidando así el medio ambiente.
El sueño de Victoria es mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y aumentar sus ingresos para dedicarse también al engorde de ganado.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Victoria is married and has three children, all of whom are in high school.  The family lives in their privately owned, six-room house.  The walls are made of brick, and the ground is made of earth.  The house is in Palomar, in the La Paz department.

Victoria makes a living selling vegetables and makes a little through cattle raising.  With the little she makes from her crops and from the sales in her shop, she must cover the costs of food, schooling, and paying the bills.  Victoria's husband does not help with costs as he works in the city.

Victoria needs this loan to buy improved seeds for vegetables.  These seeds will help her save time as they do not need watering often and they grow more quickly.  The ground will not deteriorate as quickly with these seeds and they are good for the environment.

Victoria's dream is to increase her income in order to provide her children with a better quality of life.  She wants to increase her income so as to spend more time raising cattle.

This is the second time that Victoria has applied for a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved vegetables seeds to grow products more quickly and with less watering required.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a 35-year-old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as aggressive. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Pius describes his biggest business challenge to be the effect of rainy season on his business. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase another motorcycle. His business goal is to purchase a vehicle within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate and feed his children. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Pav

texts.en:
Pav is 49 years of age and she continuously operates a farming business as a source of income. She primarily grows rice and cassavas on her own land in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. This business is a great help in supporting her three children. Her husband and children also help her in developing her business.

Pav would like to acquire a loan of 1,200 US dollars as additional working capital; it will be used to hire local laborers to weed her cassava plantation.  She will also use a portion of the loan to buy fishing materials such as a boat, net, and other traps.

She hopes that this time she could be able to enlarge her profit for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to hire local laborers to weed her cassava plantation.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
