Doña Gladys es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder sentirse independiente se dedica a la venta de joyas, ella vende todo tipo de joyas como cadenas, aretes, esclavas, anillos y todos en oro de la mejor calidad. Su forma de venta es informal ella recorre ofreciendo estos productos o si no vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 9  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, las joyas se las envían de Chordeleg lugar donde realizan las mejores joyas en el Ecuador, aunque en ocasiones viaja hasta este lugar a comprar.
Este crédito es para comprar joyas de todo tipo. Lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 
Su sueño es tener una joyería.
texts.en:
The Siempre Unidas [Always United] Communal Bank meets twice a month in the Jipijapa Canton, which is called the Sultan of Coffee for the canton's extensive coffee crops and their unmatched flavor, the local cuisine, and the warmth of Jipijapa's people. This is where Doña Gladiz, aged 53, lives. She is married to the father of her three children, a teacher. 

Doña Gladiz is a housewife who works selling jewelry in order to earn her own income and gain a sense of independence. Doña Gladiz sells all types of jewelry, such as chains, earrings, bracelets, rings, all made of the highest-quality gold. She sells the jewelry outside the home, but also hosts her most familiar customers at her home. Doña Gladiz's customers can buy on credit and she collects payments every eight days. She has over nine years experience selling jewelry and the business is doing well. Doña Gladiz's jewelry is delivered from Chordeleg, where artisans make the best jewelry in Ecuador, and where she sometimes goes to buy merchandise directly. 

This loan is for the purchase of all types of jewelry. Doña Gladiz has been with the Communal Bank for two years and likes that payments are easy to make. Her ambition is to one day own a jewelry shop.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 36 years old and married, with three children who are in school.  Dinah works very hard to provide for them.

Dinah runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Dinah has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y uno de 15 años el cual  estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos aun vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Narcisa es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto salir adelante ya que  su esposo no puede trabajar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo, artículos para el hogar por cartillas y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días ya que ella sale a recorrer y también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 14 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Siempre Unidas” communal bank meets every fifteen days in the cantón of Jipijapa, a cantón known by the name of the sultan of coffee because of the extensive plantations of coffee, which has incomparable flavor, and for its food and the warmth of its people.

This is where Naricisa lives. She is 56 years old and is married. From that marriage she has four children, three who are of age and one who is 15 years old and is studying in high school. All of her children live with her. Her husband doesn’t work because of health-related reasons. 

Narcisa is a homemaker who, in order to obtain her own money and get ahead since her husband can’t work, works in commerce. She sells clothing via catalogues, household items, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works every day since she goes out to sell and also sells from her house, where she has some vitrines. She sells her products on credit and charges every eight days. She has been working in this activity for 15 years and it is going very well for her. What she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics, since they are very good. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing. She has been in the communal bank for 14 years and she likes it because they grant her the loans. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

Eliza has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell.

Eliza has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Eliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emma has been raising pigs for two years.  She also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Claire

texts.fr: Claire est une femme mariée de 39ans à un soudeur. Elle a un enfant de 6ans scolarisé. Elle est achète et revend des kits de transferts, des cartes de recharge et des kits des kits de connexion au marché à toutes personnes. Elle sollicite un second prêt auprès de WAGES pour l’achat de kit de transfert, de cartes de recharges et des kits de connexion pour la revente. Elle exerce son activité depuis 2005. Elle espère devenir grossiste et avoir une bonne famille.
texts.en: Claire is a 39-year-old woman married to a welder. She has a 6-year-old child who attends school. Claire is in the business of purchasing and reselling telephone transfer kits, recharge cards, and connection kits at a local market to all types of customers. She is requesting a second loan from WAGES in order to purchase transfer kits, recharge cards, and connection kits for resale. She has been in business since 2005. She hopes one day to become a wholesaler and to have a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards and connection kits

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es de la ciudad de Pilar, es el estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial. Es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por poder crecer y el día de mañana ser un gran profesional.
Su meta es lograr a ser un profesional calificado para un buen desempeño. Vive con sus padres, tiene 2 hermanos. Comenta además que quiere ayudar a su familia y poder aportar en la casa.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de universidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Luis is from the city of Pilar and is a student of industrial engineering. He is a person who works hard to grow and in the future he will be a great professional. 
His goal is to be a qualified professional and perform well. He lives with his parents and has two siblings. He says he wants to help his family and to contribute in the household. 
He is applying for this loan in order to invest in the payment of his fees and to cover college expenses. He is thankful for the opportunity he is getting to keep growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees and cover college expenses.

loans.name: Elsa Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Siempre Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  22, 21 y 8  años de edad,  la mayor estudia en universidad y el menor en escuela los dos aun  viven con ella. Su esposo tiene un taller de soldadura y pintura de carros.
Doña Elsa con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos como ropa, zapatos y productos de Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace dos años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Lleva más de 4 años en  el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Siempre Unidas” communal bank meets every fifteen days in the cantón of Jipijapa, a cantón known by the name of the sultan of coffee because of the extensive plantations of coffee, which has an incomparable flavor, and for its food and the warmth of its people.

This is where Elsa lives. She is 39 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has three children who are 22, 21, and 18 years old. The oldest is studying at university and the youngest is in school. Both of them live with her. Her husband has a shop where he solders and paints cars. 

Elsa, with the goal of having her own income, works selling products from catalogs, such as clothing, shoes, and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories). She sells door to door and by orders. She works every day, especially in the morning hours since this is when it’s easier for her to go out and make her sales. She sells on credit and charges each week. She loves sales and she has been doing this for two years, during which time things have gone very well for her because she has a lot of customers. What she sells the most are cosmetics and perfumes. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and lotions. She has been in the communal bank for 4 year and she likes it because it was with those loans that she started her business. 

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and lotions.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.  She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 35 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Lolita has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tovinonvigbe Group

texts.fr: TOVINONVIGBE est un groupe composé de huit personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Antoinette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 48 ans. Antoinette n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Antoinette est mariée à un cultivateur nommé Roger. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Antoinette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que Antoinette vend des boissons alcoolisés communément appelé "Sodabi" et de la farine de manioc "gari" dans sa région depuis cinq ans. Antoinette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Antoinette s’associe aux autres membres du groupe TOVINONVIGBE pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Tovinonvigbe is a group made up of 8 people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, named Antoinette (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 48 years old. Antoinette did not attend school. She is married to a farmer named Roger. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care.

Antoinette lives with her husband and their children. Together, the couple is responsible for the household expenses. It is for this reason that Antoinette has been selling the alcoholic beverages locally called "Sodabi" as well as "gari" cassava flour in her region for the last five years. She stocks up in a market in Benin. In order to expand her business, Antoinette and the other members of the Tovinonvigbe group are partnering to request a third loan from ALIDé. Their previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase "Sodabi" alcoholic beverages and "gari" cassava flour

loans.name: Aïdekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AÏDEKON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Huguette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Huguette a très peu fréquenté l’école. Huguette est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et cinq à leur charge. Huguette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Huguette et son mari. Pour ce faire, Huguette vend du maïs et du gari (farine fait à base de manioc) dans sa région depuis quatre ans. Huguette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de développer son activité, Huguette s’associe aux autres membres du groupe AÏDEKON pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Aïdekon group is made up of three people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, named Huguette (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 29 years old. She attended very little schooling. Huguette is married to Antoine, and the couple has six children, some of whom attend school and five of whom are still in their care.

Huguette lives with her husband and children, and together they provide for the support of the household. In order to accomplish this, Huguette has sold corn and "gari" (a flour made from cassava) in her region for the last 4 years. She stocks up in a market in Benin. In order to expand her business Huguette and the other members of the Aïdekon group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase corn and gari (a flour made from cassava)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 55 años vive al lado de su esposa, la cual es su fuerza y sobre todo quien le da ánimo para seguir y salir adelante, la vivienda de Luis se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona; la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo  se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Luis es un hombre muy trabajador, día a día traba en su parcela, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y sobre todo le gusta mucho su trabajo por ello el cree que le va bien, porque lo trabaja de buena manera y muchos ánimos.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar semillas, abono, fertilizantes, así como también cubrir los gastos de riego y limpieza de la parcela, de esta manera el podrá sembrar su cultivo y podrá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una hacienda”.
texts.en:
Luis, age 55, lives with his wife.  She is his strength, and, above all, she is the one who motivates him to get ahead.  Luis’s house is in the city of Ica in the Parcona district.  The city is known for being very warm and welcoming.

He works with agriculture and livestock.  Luis is a very hard-working man.  He works on his plot of land day to day.  He works around nine hours a day.  Above all, he really likes his work.  He believes that it is going well for him because he works well and with a lot of energy.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers.  He will also cover the expenses for watering and clearing the weeds from the land.  This way he will be able to plant his crop.  He will be able to continue struggling each day in order to be able to make his biggest dream come true.  He dream is to have a farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is a 25-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with five children. The oldest is eight while the youngest is one year old. Her husband works as a fisherman to support their family. She engages in the fish vending business. She sells fish to help augment the income of their household. Her business started five years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of fresh fish to resell to attract more customers.

In the future, Maria Theresa would like to expand her fish vending business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 60 years old, single, and is working hard to earn a living.

Magdalena has a buy-and-sell spice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell like onion, garlic, dried beans, etc.

Magdalena has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell like onion, garlic, dried beans, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 30 years old and has four children. She is married and her four children are in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Analyn has been buying and selling livestock for eleven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is 31 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are in school.

Rosenie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Rosenie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosenie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Doélé

texts.fr: Doelé est une femme mariée de 27ans à un enseignant d’état avec un enfant de 3ans. Elle exerce depuis 2009. Elle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale à tous dans sa boutique. Elle demande son troisième prêt pour l’achat et la vente de produits alimentation générale et réinvestir dans son activité. Elle compte agrandir son activité et assurer l’avenir de toute la famille.
texts.en: Doélé is a 27-year-old woman married to a teacher with a 3-year-old child. She has been in business since 2009, purchasing and reselling general food products from her shop. She is requesting her third loan for the purchase and sale of general food products and to reinvest in her business. She hopes to grow her business and to provide a future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase general food products

loans.name: Ayidekon De Ze Togoudo Group

texts.fr: AYIDEKON DE ZE TOGOUDO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Valentine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 33 ans. Valentine  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Valentine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Benoît. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Valentine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Valentine et son mari. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Valentine vend du gari (farine de manioc) et des poulets dans sa région depuis trois ans. Valentine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Valentine s’associe aux autres membres du groupe AYIDEKON DE ZE TOGOUDO pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Ayidekon De Ze Togoudo is a group made up of three people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, named Valentine (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 33 years old. Valentine did not attend school. She is married to a farmer named Benoît. The couple has two children, one of whom attends school, and both of whom are in their care. Valentine lives with her husband and their children, and together they provide for the support of the household.

In order to provide for the family's needs, Valentine has been selling gari (cassava flour) and chickens in her region for three years. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to improve her business, Valentine partnered with the other members of Ayidekon De Ze Togoudo to request a second loan from ALIDé. Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase gari (cassava flour) and chickens

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ludy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling feeds. Ludy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Ludy has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Manilen

texts.en:
Manilen is 22 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Manilen is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Manilen has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Manilen would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jebeth

texts.en:
Jebeth is a 23-year-old single woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She has a vegetable business. She sells eggplant, squash, beans, tomatoes, green onions, and other green leafy vegetables to help augment the income of her household. 

Jebeth started her business 1 year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy dried fish, oil, and eggs to maintain the inventory of the store. In the future, Jebeth hopes to expand her vegetable business and increase profitability to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, oil, and eggs.

loans.name: Kanouya ( L’Amour) Group

texts.fr:
Kanouya est un regroupement de femmes de Baramba qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, sont mariées avec en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, la vente des graines d’arachide, de haricot, des condiments, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt de groupe. 
Kadia  est un membre du groupe Kanouya est la 2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs d’arachide et toutes sortes de condiments. Elle se procure de ces condiments à Baramba et revend  en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kanouya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadia compte réaliser  55 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kanouya is a group of women from Baramba who know each other well and who live in traditional large families with their husbands, children, and other parents. The women have an average age of 39 years, are married, and have an average of 4 children each. The women of this group are in different businesses, such as the sale of peanuts, beans, spices, etc.

In order to increase their businesses, the members of the group decided to partner with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Kadia is a member of the Kanouya group and is the second pictured sitting from right to left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to purchase bags of peanuts and all kinds of spices. She purchases these spices in Baramba and resells them at retail for cash from her home and in the market to a diverse customer base. While the other members of the Kanouya group hope to earn an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA each during the course of the loan cycle, Kadia hopes to earn 55,000 francs CFA. In addition to repaying the loan, the women will use a portion of their earnings to care for their personal expenses and to increase their business funds.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Tagne (Aller De L’Avant) Group

texts.fr:
Tagne est un regroupement de femmes de Baramba qui se connaissent bien et  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont mariées et avec en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers, de  la restauration etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt de groupe. 
Diarra  est un membre du groupe Tagne, debout avec une louche qui sert à enlever ses grillades de l’huile.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de haricot et de l’huile. Elle se procure  du sac de haricot au marché. Elle vend son beignet bien cuit au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Tagne comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Diarra  compte réaliser  60 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Tagne is a group of women from Baramba who know each other well and who live in traditional larger families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They have an average age of 30 years, are married, and have an average of 4 children each. The women of the group are in the business of selling various items, catering, etc.

In order to increase their businesses, the women decided to partner with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan. Diarra is a member of the Tagne group, pictured standing with a ladle that is used to remove grilled items from the oil. She plans on using her loan to purchase a bag of beans and oil. She purchases the beans at the market, and resells her cooked pastries for cash from her home and at the market to a diverse customer base. 

While the other members of the Tagne group hope to earn an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA each at the end of the loan cycle, Diarra hopes to earn 60,000 francs CFA. In addition to repayment of the loan, the women will use a portion of their earnings to care for their personal expenses and to increase their business funds.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds and oil for preparing pastries

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 59 years old, married, and has ten children.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like rice, snack foods, noodles, and other groceries.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from dressmaking.

Luzviminda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, snack foods, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en: Patrocinia, is 33 years old, married, has four children, and lives in Aurora, Misamis Occidental along with her family. She helps her husband to operate their own farmland, planting and harvesting bananas and corn for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business three years. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and her previous loan that she used for their farm was successfully repaid. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase a new variety of  corn seeds and organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of corn seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Wassa( La Satisfaction) Group

texts.fr:
Wassa est un regroupement de femmes de Baramba qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, vente de riz, de graines d’arachide, d’haricot et des paniers, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt de groupe. 
Mife  est un membre du groupe Wassa , assise  au milieu.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs d’haricot et des paniers pour la vente. Elle se procure de ces sacs d’haricot au marché et quant aux paniers, confectionnés par son mari, elle les achète sur place. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Wassa comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Mife compte réaliser  60 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses de la famille et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Wassa is a group of women from Baramba who know each other well and live in traditional large families with their husbands, children, and other parents. The women have an average age of 40 years, are married, and have at least 5 children each. The women of this group are in business selling various items, such as rice, peanuts, beans, baskets, etc. In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to partner with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Mife is a member of the Wassa group, pictured seated in the middle of the photo. She plans to use her loan to purchase bags of beans and baskets for resale. She purchases the beans at the market and the baskets, which are made by her husband, she purchases locally. She sells these items at retail for cash from her home and in the market to a diverse customer base. 

While the other members of the Wassa group hope to earn an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA at the end of the loan cycle, Mife hopes to earn 60,000 francs CFA. In addition to repaying the loan, the women will use a portion of the earnings to care for their family's expenses and to increase their business funds.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Né vers 1966, marié et père de 5 enfants, Lassina est un Pharmacien qui vit dans la ville de Koutiala.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients de plus en plus nombreux, il décide de faire recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui, il est à son 3ème prêt,  qui sera utilisé pour l’achat des produits pharmaceutiques auprès des laboratoires de distribution de produits pharmaceutiques de Bamako. Il effectue sa vente en détail au comptant, à une clientèle mixte.
LASSINA envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born in 1966, married and the father of 5 children, Lassina is a pharmacist who lives in the city of Koutiala. In order to meet his growing customers' needs, he decided to partner with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his third loan. He will use this loan to purchase pharmaceutical products from laboratories for distribution in Bamako. He makes his sales at retail for cash, to a customer base of both men and women. Lassina hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA which he will use to repay the loan, take care of his family's expenses, and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase pharmaceutical items

loans.name: Mariacil

texts.en:
Mariacil works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Mariacil requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of clothing to sell. Mariacil has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 44 years old, married, and has six children; five of her children are in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Merlinda has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leonisa requested a 12,000  PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, and other products. Leonisa has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Leonisa would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, and other products.

loans.name: Hatedia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Hatedia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Hatedia is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Hatedia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years. Jocelyn earns additional income from raising pigs and chickens.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family, and so her children can finish their studies in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 46 years old,married, and has five children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell like soap, sugar, milk, coffee, spices, etc.

Arlene has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Arlene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell like soap, sugar, milk, coffee, spices, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia, a 60-year-old resident of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur provides for her children's needs from the little amount she earns from her piggery for more than three years. She joined GDMPC in 2012 and her previous loan that she used to buy feed was successfully repaid. Aside from her piggery, she also has a garden of vegetables which she sells in the market to make an extra income for the family. Recently, she has just started cultivating a new plot of vegetables. For this, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy an organic fertilizer and assorted varieties of vegetable seeds. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy an organic fertilizer and assorted varieties of vegetable seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Estrella Soledad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 55 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, todos aun viven en su casa a pesar de que ya están comprometidos. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
Doña Estrella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren alguna prenda. Trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil o a Manta cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene más de 6  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque el grupo es unido y confiable. 
Su sueño es tener salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The December 24th communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts that are recognized at both a national and international level.  It is the home of the famous panama straw hat.

This is where Señora Estrella lives.  She is 55 years old, married, and has three older children from this relationship.  They all still live in her home although they are already engaged.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

With the intention of earning something for her account and using this to get ahead at home, Doña Estrella makes a living selling all kinds of clothing.  She sells door to door and also out of her home, where her customers come when they want a garment.  She works every day without a set schedule, sells to her customers via credit, and collects every 15 days.  To buy her merchandise she goes to Guayaquil or Manta every 15 days to a month, according to her need.  She has spent more than 6 years making a living through this work and it is going well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because the group is close and trustworthy.  Her dream is to have health for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries for her general store business.

Marina has been in this business for 5 years. Marina earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Josephine is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, cream, etc,. for her general store business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, cream, etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish selling business.

Nelly has been in this business for 7 years. Nelly earns additional income from pig fattening.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop.  Melanie is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, butter, and other items for her food vending business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, butter, and other items.

loans.name: Mercedes Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 47 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tuvo seis hijos pero dos fallecieron, de los 4 que tiene tres son  mayores de edad, el menor tiene 12 años y estudia en escuela, todos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es obrero.
Doña Mercedes para salir adelante ya que a su esposo no le alcanza con lo que gana, desde hace dos años atrás surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa la cual le permite ganarse algo por el bienestar de su familia y suyo, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  agua en bidón sodas y golosinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda cuando el llega de su trabajo o cuando está desocupado, empezó su negocio con muy poco de dinero que tenia y con la ayuda de uno de los créditos y así con los que ha recibido la fue aumentando y surtiendo poco a poco. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda ya que va a comprar víveres, frutas y legumbres. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 
Sus sueños seguir mejorando y tener un mejor local.
texts.en:
The "24 de Diciembre"  communal bank meets every fortnight in the Canton of Montecristi. This city is known for it's rich precolonial culture and it's handicrafts which are recognized at a national and international level. This is the home of the famous Panama hat. 

Mercedes lives here. She is 47 years old, married and from this union has six children. Two of them died and of the other four, three are still minors. The youngest, 12, studies in school. They all live at home. Her husband is a laborer. 

Two years ago, seeing that her husband's earnings couldn't cover all their expenses, Mercedes started  to stock a small store with food in order to get ahead. This allows her to make something for her well-being and that of her family. The store is located in their house.  She sells all sorts of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables, fruits, water in 19 liter bottles and sweets. She works every day from 6 am until 8 pm, sometimes even later. Her husband helps her when he gets home from work and when he is unemployed. She started the business with the little money she had and with the help of the loans she has received, the business has grown and  become better stocked little by little. 

Mercedes will use this loan to stock her store more as she will buy food, fruits and vegetables. Mercedes has been a member of the communal bank since it's inception. She likes it as the loans are a great help. Her dream is to continue improving and to have a better store.

loans.use: to buy provisions, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc., for her general store business.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years. Lolita earns additional income from farming rice.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 45 years old and married with four children. Marlyn works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, eggs, noodles, cream, soft drinks, and other products. Marlyn has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years, and also earns an income from farming rice. Marlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, eggs, noodles, cream, soft drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 67 years old and widowed with six children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase inventory to sell like soap, cream, soft drinks, eggs, spices, etc.

Editha has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Editha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell like soap, cream, soft drinks, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old, widowed, and has five children. Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from raising pigs. Evelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a 60-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married and has 4 grown children. Her husband worked as driver to support their family. 

She has a food vending business. She sells homemade meals like fish soup, stewed vegetables, fried chicken, and pancit bihon (very thin rice noodles fried with soy sauce, citrus, and some variation of sliced meat and chopped vegetables) to help augment the income of her household. She started her business 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy various supplies such as seasoning, fish, meat, rice, and soft drinks.

In the future, Victoriana hopes to expand her food vending business and increase profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seasoning, fish, meat, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc., for her general store business.

Mary Joy has been in this business for 4 years. Mary Joy earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like colored chalk, tape measures, linens, etc., for her tailoring business.

Consolacion has been in this business for 3 years. Consolacion earns additional income from pig fattening.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like colored chalk, tape measures, linens, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married. with four children; two of her children are in school. Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years.  She sells a variety of items, such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Percys

texts.en:
Percys is married, with one child. She is 31 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines.

Percys is a farmer who grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer for her corn and to acquire additional housing materials, such as cement, common nails, plywood, etc.

Percys has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Percys hopes to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn and to acquire housing materials such as cement, common nails, and plywood.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comités, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder trabajar juntas y poder mejorar sus vidas y su economía.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucy, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con gran esfuerzo ha podido superarse y ayudar a su familia por medio de ese trabajo. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y mejorando para ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, camisas, shorts, pantalones y demás, con lo que podrá seguir invirtiendo en su emprendimiento y mejorando su economía.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Guapa is in its second cycle of committees.  They are doing a survey on the elimination of poverty to be able to work together and to be able to improve their lives and finances.

One of the member is Ms. Lucy, who sells a variety of clothing.  She is a very hardworking woman who with a lot of sacrifice has been able to advance ahead and help her family through this work.  Her goal is to be able to continue expanding and improving to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing T-shirts, shirts, shorts, pants and so forth.  With this she can continue investing in her business venture and improving her finances.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, shorts, pants, and so forth.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 51 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Amparo is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Amparo requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise.

Amparo has been raising livestock for twenty years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amparo would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 35 years old, widowed, and has six children. Four of her children are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As the widowed mother of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Teresita has sustained her business activities through no fewer than 17 past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her pottery.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years. Erlinda earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sherry Ann

texts.en: Sherry Ann, 24, is borrowing 5,000 PHP as additional working capital for her retailing business. She will use it to purchase face powder, lipsticks, shoes, slippers and eyeliners. These goods would possibly create better earnings. She hopes that her requested amount will be provided. She is aspiring for a better way of living for her family, so she really gives her best to earn a good income for them.

loans.use: to purchase face powder, lipsticks, shoes, slippers, and eyeliners

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 63 years old and a widow, with six children. She's been into buying and selling rice and corn for almost 15 years.  In this business she's earning a net income of PHP 3,500 weekly. 

Due to a lack of capital she has request a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase more rice and corn to sell. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can able to earn more profits in her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn to sell

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 52 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun  viven en su casa. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
Doña Ana es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante con el fruto de su trabajo, ella realiza trabajos de limpieza faciales y también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella realiza sus trabajos ya sea en su casa o a domicilio y al mismo tiempo va ofreciendo sus productos, lleva más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le ayuda a sacar adelante su hogar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar productos para las limpiezas faciales y productos  Yanbal. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan para salir adelante. 
Su sueño es tener un spa.
texts.en:
The "24 de diciembre" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and its artisan products that are known at both a national and international level.  It is from here that the famous straw hat originates.

It is here that Ana lives.  She is 52 years old, married and has two children, now adults.  One of her children still lives at home.  Ana's husband is a security guard.

Ana is a feisty woman who likes to make use of her time and skills in order to get ahead through her work.  Ana works giving facial treatments, and also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, make-up, perfumes, and women's accessories).  She works from her own home or does home visits for the facial treatments, and offers her customers Yanbal products.  Ana has been doing this work for seven years and it allows her to help her household to prosper.

Ana will use this loan to buy products for facial masks, and Yanbal products.  Ana has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it as the loans have helped her to get ahead.

Ana's dream is to have a spa.

loans.use: to buy products for facial masks, and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Glenda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pottery. Glenda is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more inventory to sell to her customers.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 33 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Geraldine is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Geraldine has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling bananas.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Angelita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 43 years old, married, and has one child.

She earns a living by farming calamans (a citrus fruit)i in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nelly has been farming calamansi for 8 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 43 years old and married with three children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  Nora is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming rice for 6 years and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rolyn

texts.en:
Rolyn is 40 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rolyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  Rolyn has been in this business for seven years.  In the future, Rolyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Jean has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.  She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin, 32 years old, lives with her spouse and three children in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. All of her children still depend on her income and care. Sin, together with her husband, cultivates their own farm, primarily growing rice both for sustenance and sales. Her husband also goes fishing for additional income during the high-water season.

Sin has nearly two hectares of rice. She needs to transplant her rice crop and apply fertilizer. Because she has inadequate capital, she would like to request a loan of KHR 800,000 to hire people to work on her farm and to buy fertilizer for her rice crop. She also plans to continue working in agriculture but hopes to expand a larger area for cultivation.

loans.use: to hire people to work on her farm and buy fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Villa Bonita Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Emprendedoras de Villa Bonita está en su ciclo número 10º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con el que conocen la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edith, quien además de ser la tesorera del grupo, se dedica a la lavandería, y es ella misma la que maneja el negocio. Es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de jabones, suavizantes, y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo y ayudar a su familia, como también mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "Emprendedoras de Villa Bonita" is in its 10th cycle of the women's committee program, where every woman works and helps each other  get ahead in life.  They are carrying out a poverty elimination survey in order to understand each other's situation.

One of the members is Señora Edith, who in addition to being the treasurer of the group makes a living through a laundromat, which she operates herself.  She is a very hard-working person who fights to get ahead in life and to help her family.

She asks for this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of soap, softener, and other supplies to continue with her work and support her family, as well as improve her income.

loans.use: to buy soap, softener, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Kuña Pora inicia el 1er. ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras, que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto de todas.
La Sra. Diana es la presidenta del grupo ella es docente y desea realizar trabajos de manualidades, es madre de 1 niño pequeño, ella  se esfuerza al máximo para llegar a ser una mujer exitosa y lo está consiguiendo a través del trabajo continuo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, pinturas,  hilos y demás insumos para poder hacer las manualidades que quiere vender. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ellas están recibiendo, ya que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The Kuña Pora group is starting its first loan cycle. These are very hardworking women who want to help their families together. Diana is the group's president. She is a teacher and wants to make crafts. She has a baby son and goes the extra mile to become a successful woman, and she is working continuously to get there. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics, dyes, thread and other supplies to make the crafts that she wants to sell. She is grateful for the opportunity this group is receiving; it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, dyes, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Alona works hard to support her family.  She has a ginger business in the Philippines.   Alona earns additional income from selling root crops and from a general store.  Alona is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years.  Jessica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials, such as bamboo and paints. 

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo and paints for her furniture business.

loans.name: Salimakhon

texts.ru:
Салимахон жительница города Конибодом, ей 59 лет. Она шьет национальные ватные одеяла. С давних времен ватные одеяла и подушки были необходимыми бытовыми принадлежностями таджикского народа. До сегодняшних дней они пользуются популярностью. Ватные одеяла для зимних холодов необходимая вещь. Многие века таджики пользуются ими и не собираются променять их на новые синтетические покрывала.
   Салимахон около 9 лет шьет такие одеяла. Научилась хитростями шитья от мамы. Салимахон сверху одеял шьет красивые ткани, чтобы зимой не только было тепло, но и красиво. С каждым днем новые виды тканей и материалов привозят в город. И Салимахон просит кредит, чтобы купить красивые ткани. Это поможет ей найти новых и постоянных клиентов.
texts.en: Salimakhon lives in the city of Konibodom and is 59 years old.  She sews quilted folk blankets.  For a long time quilted blankets and pillows have been necessary household items of the Tajik people, and to this day they remain popular.  Quilted blankets are necessary items during the cold winter.  For many decades the Tajik people have used these blankets and they do not plan on giving them up for new synthetic blankets.  Salimakhon has been sewing blankets for about 9 years, and learned to sew from her mother.  Salimakhon sews the top parts of the blanket with beautiful fabrics so that winter won't be simply warm, but also pretty.  Each day new types of fabric and materials arrive in the city, and Salimakhon is asking for a loan to purchase beautiful fabric.  This will help her to find new and regular customers.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to sew quilted blankets

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry está iniciando el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas y cada una de ellas está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Marta es la presidenta del grupo, ella es artesana, tiene 2 hijos y vive en casa propia, se dedica a trabajar la lana, haciendo todo tipo de artículos de ese producto. Ella se esfuerza al máximo para llegar a ser una mujer exitosa y lo está consiguiendo a través del trabajo continuo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de lana, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo y ayudando por medio de sus ingresos a su familia.
texts.en: The Kuña Katupyry group is beginning its first loan cycle in the program for enterprising women, and all of the members are giving their best effort to grow and make headway. Marta is the group's president. She is an artisan, has two children and lives in her own home. She makes a living working with wool, making all kinds of items with it. She goes the extra mile to become a successful woman, and is getting there through nonstop work. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of wool, which will allow her to keep growing her business and earning income to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase wool to make crafts.

loans.name: Ángela Victoria

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 16, 14, 13 y 11 años de edad, los  tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un barco pesquero.
Doña Ángela es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque en su casa también tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales ofrece sus productos. Trabaja todos los fines de semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 4  años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables. 
Su sueño es tener un barco propio.
texts.en:
The 24 de Diciembre Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial cultural and for its handicrafts, which are renowned both nationally and internationally. This is also the place of the famous panama straw hat.

This is where Sra. Angela lives. She is 36 years old and married. She and her husband have four children who are 16, 14, 13 and 11 years of age. The oldest three are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband works on a fishing boat.

Doña Angela is a housewife who sells all kinds of clothing in order to earn her own income. She sells door to door and also has display cabinets in her home where she offers her wares. She works every weekend and allows her customers to buy on credit and collects from them every week. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to. She has had this business for four years and started it with her first loan.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts and children’s clothing. She has been a member of  this communal bank for four years and she enjoys it because her colleagues are very responsible.

Her dream is to have her own boat.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Son mujeres que vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa, y es por eso que se han unido.
Una de ellas es Gloria, quien se dedica a la costura, y comenta que hace todo tipo de prendas y con ello cumple con los pedidos de sus clientes. Se ha hecho de una buena clientela, ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos que gustan a sus clientes. Tiene como sueño poder ir creciendo y poder dar trabajo a otras personas que al igual que ella quieren salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo su costura y cumpliendo con su clientela.
texts.en: This group is in its seventh loan cycle in the women's group program, and all of the members work and help each other to make headway. These women saw a great opportunity with this program, and that's why they all came together. One of the members is Gloria, who makes a living in sewing. She says that she makes all kinds of garments to fulfill her customers' orders. She has built a good clientele because she always makes very good items that her customers love. Her dream is to be able to keep growing and to be able to give work to others so they can also make headway. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, fasteners and other supplies in order to keep sewing and satisfying her customers.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, fasteners and other supplies.

loans.name: Egamberdi

texts.ru: Эгамберди  добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Живёт он вместе со своим отцом, в его доме. Он с малых лет помогал отцу заниматься животноводством и земледелием и набрался большого опыта в этом деле. Его жена очень трудолюбивая женщина. Вместе со своей женой Эгамберди ведут бизнес животноводства. Он покупают малых телят, затем вскармливают их и продают мясо и молоко, полученное от этого скота. От этого бизнеса Эгамберди получает хороший стабильный доход. Также он выращивает  картошку, а потом продаёт. Хоть это и сезонный бизнес, но он также приносит хороший дополнительный доход. Эгамберди сотрудничает с Арванд с 2012 года и его жена рассказывает, что после того, как они стали сотрудничать с Арванд,  их  жизнь изменилась в лучшую сторону. Получая прибыль от бизнеса, они смогли организовать свадьбу своего сына. Сейчас Эгамберды вновь обратился в Авранд и хочет получить кредит на покупку несколько голов скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Egamberdi is a good-natured and cheerful man of 30.  He is married and has two children.  He lives with his father in his father's home.  He has helped his father with animal-husbandry and agriculture since he was young, and has a lot of experience.  His wife is a very hard-working woman and Egamberdi and his wife are engaged in the business of animal husbandry.  He purchases young calves, fattens them, and then sells milk and meat from the full-grown cattle.  Egamberdi makes good money in this business. He also grows and sells potatoes, and, though this is a seasonal business, it also brings in good money.  In 2012 Egamberdi partnered with Arvand and his wife says that since then their lives have changed for the better.  With the profit from their business, they were able to put together a wedding for their son.  Egamberdi has again turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase several head of cattle to expand his business.  He thanks Arvand in advance for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sayfiddin

texts.ru: Сайфиддин жизнерадостный и добродушный мужчина в возрасте 43 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Сайфидин  обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он с юных лет помогал своему отцу в ведении бизнеса животноводства. И сам набрал опыт в ведении данного дела. На сегодня имея свою семью, он самостоятельно занимается животноводством, у него это хорошо получается. И от этого бизнеса он получает хороший доход, что позволяет ему удовлетворять все нужды своей семьи. Развивая этот бизнес, Сайфиддин хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота, а также построить коровник для своего скота.  Семья также помогает ему, жена  продаёт молоко, полученное от имеющегося скота. Сайфиддин хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота для дальнейшего откармливания и продажи. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Sayfiddin is a cheerful and goodnatured man of 43.  He is married and has two children.  Sayfiddin turned to Arvand for financial support and wants a loan to purchase cattle.
