texts.en: Jennifer is 38 years of age, managing a charcoal making in the village. She has been operating this business for four months and is very happy for the appreciation of the people. Now, she is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase hardwood to make charcoal. She dreams of a bigger business and she is doing her best to make it a reality.

loans.use: to purchase hardwood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Divina has been in this business for 2 years. Divina earns more income from pig fattening.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosary

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Rosary works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosary is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy a fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Rosary has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is 38 years old and married with three children.

Rocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Rocelyn has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Rocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Harlene

texts.en:
Harlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Harlene has been in this business for two years. Harlene earns additional income from food-vending.

Harlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Polina

texts.en: Polina used the previous loan to buy drugs to sell in her drug store. She is a 24-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. For six years, she has had a drug store business and she has been a very good client of Hofokam who says she has grown with the loan facilities offered to her. Her hardships are customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house, while her business goals are buying land to grow crops and moving her business to a more permanent location. Polina is requesting money to buy drugs to sell at her drug store.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell in her drug store.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 8 детей. У Гулнары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулнара занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 12 овец, а также обрабатывает земельный надел мерою 4 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулнара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulnara is 53 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising eight children. Gulnara has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Gulnara practices livestock breeding. She started this business 6 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's hard work, she currently has on her farm: 1 milk cow, 1 horse and 12 sheep. She also works a 4 hectare plot of land on which she grows perennial grasses every year. Her monthly income is 3,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulnara turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle to increase the size of her herd. Gulnara plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es: Blanca a sus 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante sola, con los ingresos que ha generado con la venta de alimentos que ella misma prepara. Inicialmente comenzó elaborando los alimentos desde su vivienda y luego, gracias a la alcaldía del municipio donde reside, recibió el permiso para vender sus productos en un kiosko ubicado en una zona muy transitada del municipio, allí ofrece productos como tamales, alimentos fritos, mecato, gaseosas, entre otros, trabaja todos los días de 6:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm y cuenta con el apoyo de una hija. Actualmente solicita el crédito para realizar adecuaciones en el negocio que le exigen las autoridades de sanidad (hacer una plancha en cemento liso) y comprar insumos al por mayor (verduras, carne, aceite, salsas, gaseosas, mecato, entre otros), de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de trabajo y aumentará las ventas, lo que para ella significa tener mejores ingresos para seguir velando por el bienestar de sus hijos, adicionalmente su negocio tendrá una mejor imagen y atraerá más clientela. Blanca desea seguir trabajando arduamente y en un futuro cercano lograr que una empresa de gaseosas muy reconocida, le brinde la opción de tener un kiosko mucho más amplio para atender mejor a sus clientes y mejorar la rentabilidad del establecimiento. Así podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y disfrutará de una vejez más tranquila teniendo una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 58 year old who is a single mother of three children, whom she has brought up alone, with income generated from the sale of food that she prepares herself. She initially started preparing food from her home and then, thanks to the mayor of her municipality, she received permission to sell her products at a kiosk located in a busy area of town. There she offers products such as tamales, fried foods, snacks, sodas, among other items.

She works every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm and has the support of her daughter. She is currently requesting a loan in order to make adjustments in the business that are required by health authorities (to make a smooth cement board ) and buy supplies in bulk (vegetables, meat, oil, sauces, sodas, snacks, among other items). This way she will improve her working conditions and increase sales, which means she will have more income to continue ensuring the welfare of her children. Also her business will look better and attract more customers. 

Blanca wants to continue working hard and in the near future hopes that a well known soda company will give her the opportunity of having a much bigger kiosk to better serve her customers and to improve the profitability of the establishment. This will provide a better quality of life for her family and she will be able to enjoy a peaceful old age, with economic stability.

loans.use: to make adjustments in the business that are required by health authorities (to make a smooth cement board) and buy supplies in bulk (vegetables, meat, oil, sauces, sodas, snacks, among other items).

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesús

texts.es: Rodrigo es un campesino de 60 años de edad, padre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar, su esposa falleció hace algún tiempo y a pesar de sus dolor,buscó opciones para salir adelante. Desde pequeño conoció las labores del campo y gracias a ello, hace aproximadamente 18 meses inició su negocio de cría y engorde de cerdos para la venta, de esta manera ha generado los recursos económicos suficientes para el sustento de su hijo y el propio. El cliente es un hombre humilde, carismático y trabajador, ha logrado salir adelante, sobrepasando muchas dificultades pero siempre con la esperanza de tener una vejez más tranquila. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar más pollos para cría,  ampliar los galpones y comprar concentrado para alimentarlos; esto le permitirá aumentar su producción para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, esto le genera más ventas y por ende más ingresos económicos. Rodrigo solo desea pasar su vejez haciendo lo que le gusta y, en un futuro espera tener la posibilidad de ampliar los galpones y aumentar aún más la producción, lo que para él significa tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 60 year old farmer, father of one son and head of his household. His wife died some time ago and despite his pain, he sought out opportunities to get ahead. Since he was young he has worked in the fields and as a result, about 18 months ago he started his own business of breeding and fattening pigs for sale. In this way he has generated sufficient income to support his son and himself. 

Rodrigo is humble, charismatic and hard-working. He has managed to get ahead, overcoming many difficulties but always with the hope of a more peaceful old age. He is requesting this loan to buy more chickens for breeding, extend his sheds and buy chicken feed. This will allow him to increase production and to meet increasing demand in the approaching holiday season. This will generate more sales and therefore more income. Rodrigo wants to spend his old age only doing what he enjoys and in the future he hopes to have the possibility to extend his sheds and further increase production, which for him means a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for breeding, extend his sheds and buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Seyyaf

texts.en:
Seyyaf is a driver who is married with two children. He is 32 years old. They havebeen IDP (internally displaced persons) for 20 years and now live in  Alixanli village in Fuzuli region, near a war zone. Their condition of life is very difficult. Seyyaf’s wife Surayya is a housewife and is not engaged in income-generating work. His children are aged 3 and 5. The elder child goes to pre-school preparation and his little child goes to kindergarten. It was noted that Seyyaf is a driver, but he doesn’t transport passengers in the city. Instead, Seyyaf is engaged in transportation between villages. For 7 years, he has been engaged in this work. Today his car is broken and he can’t work.

Today he needs 2100 AZN to repair his car. He wants to buy a new wheel and a motor for his car. Seyyaf is sure that if his car is repaired, his monthly income will increase and his family's quality of life will be better.

Seyyaf is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the aid. In the future he wants to open a food market of his own.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel and a motor for his car.

loans.name: Hayriddin

texts.ru:
Мужчина на фотографии это Хайриддин. Он работает таксистом. Возит людей по одному маршруту город Душанбе-район Хамадони и обратно. Хайриддину 32 года. Он еще не женат. Живет с матерью и сестрой. Отца уже давно нет в живых. Мать Хайриддина домохозяйка, а сестра на рынке продает детскую одежду. 
    Хайриддин 3 года доставляет людей из одной точки до другой. Для него это единственный источник дохода. В данный момент машина Хайриддина сломана и срочно нуждается в ремонте. У Хайриддина нет средств, чтобы отремонтировать автомобиль. Он нуждается в кредите, чтобы приобрести автозапчасти и вернуться к работе.
texts.en:
The man in the photograph is Hayriddin. He works as a taxi driver. He transports people along one route: from the city of Dushanbe to the Hamadoni district and back. Hayriddin is 32 years old. He is unmarried. He lives with his mother and sister. His father passed away a long time ago. Hayriddin's mother is a homemaker and his sister sells children's clothing at the market. 

For 3 years, Hayriddin has been transporting people from one point to another. This is his only source of income. Currently, Hayriddin's car is broken and urgently needs to be repaired. Hayriddin does not have the money to repair his automobile. He is in need of a loan to buy car repair parts and return to work.

loans.use: to buy car parts to repair his car.

loans.name: Lluliana

texts.es: Lluliana, de 32 años, está casada con Alex y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus suegros. Lluliana se dedica a la venta de pescado, tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por la población, afortunadamente tiene buenas ventas y considerables ganancias, pero este trabajo merece de mucho sacrificio ya que para conseguir los buenos y frescos productos que ofrece a sus clientes tiene que madrugar e ir al puerto de la ciudad a las 04 de la mañana, sin embargo, sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena y es recompensado al ver que sus hijos tienen todo lo necesario para estar cómodos. Lleva en este negocio 08 años, trabaja al lado de su esposo. Le gusta la libertad que le brinda este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y practicando algún deporte además de estar al lado de su familia, espera seguir trabajando para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio y tener mayor variedad de pescados para ofrecer a sus clientes. Este es su crédito número 02 con Kiva, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/. 500 comprará pescados al por mayor.
texts.en: Lluliana, 32 years old, is married to Alex and has four children. They all live together in Lluliana's parents-in-law's house.  Lluliana makes a living selling fish.  She has a stall in one of the town's busiest markets.  Fortunately she makes good sales and considerable profits but the work requires a lot of sacrifice: in order to find good, fresh products to offer to customers, Lluliana has to wake up early to go to the city's port at 4am.  However, she knows that her effort is worth the trouble and she sees the fruits of her labour when her children have everything they need.  Lluliana has had this business for eight years, and she works alongside her husband. Lluliana likes the freedom this business gives her, as she can have fun in the afternoon playing sports and being with her family.  Lluliana hopes to continue working in order to continue expanding her business and to have a greater variety of fish to offer her customers.  This is Lluliana's second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the opportunity and for the trust being put in her.  Lluliana promises to make her repayments on time.  This loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles will be used to buy fish in bulk.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Mary Vic

texts.en:
Mary Vic, 23, is a married resident of P-Vanda, Brgy.Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). They have 1 child. Starting with a capitalization of 15,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in February 2013 and this is her 2nd loan. 

Now she is applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila, 59, is married, and together with her husband, she is raising five children. She has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. She started this business 31 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a milk cow, heifer and sheep on her farm.

For the purpose of further developing her business she has applied to VFAC for a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN to buy one cow to increase the size of her herd. She intends to save money for the wedding of her daughter from the income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Pulchérie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 55 ans. Pulchérie est mariée à un certain Nicolas. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Pulchérie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, dame Pulchérie vend du maïs et des condiments dans sa région depuis cinq ans. Pulchérie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Pulchérie s’associe aux autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group "Dieu est Grand" (God is Great) is made up of three women who live in the same village.  The group representative is Pulchérie (seen in the photo with her hand raised).  She is 55 years old and married to Nicolas.  The couple have two children who are both in school.  Pulchérie lives with her husband and their children, and together they provide for the support of the children and household.  To do this, Pulchérie sells maize, spices and seasoning locally.  She has had this business for five years and buys her stocks at a market in Bénin.

In order to increase the size of her business, Pulchérie has joined with the other women in the "Dieu est Grand" Group to request a second loan from the field partner Alidé.  Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy maize, spices and seasonings.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Mangni Symphorose (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 31 ans. Mangni Symphorose n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mangni Symphorose est mariée à un cultivateur  du nom de Vincent. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Mangni Symphorose vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Mangni Symphorose et son mari. Pour ce faire, Mangni Symphorose vend de la nourriture( riz accompagné de sauce et de boissons dans sa région depuis deux ans. Mangni Symphorose s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Mangni Symphorose s’associe aux autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jesukpego is a group of three women who live in the same village.  The group representative is Mangni Symphorose (seen in the photo with her hand raised).  Mangni Symphorose is 31 years old and did not attend school.  She is married to Vincent, a farmer.  The couple have two children, one of whom attends school.  Mangni Symphorose lives with her husband and children, and together they provide for the support of the household and the children.  To do this, she sells food (rice and sauce, and drinks) locally.  She has run this business for two years.  Mangni Symphorose buys her supplies at a  market in Bénin. 

In order to improve her business, Mangni Symphorose has joined with the other women of the Jesukpego Group to request this first loan from the field partner Alidé.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetable oil and drinks.

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Silvia de 36 años de edad, solo estudio tercer grado, ya que por motivos económicos no pudo continuar con sus estudios. Ella era casada, pero su esposo murió hace 5 años y le dejo 5 hijos; posteriormente, se acompañó con otro y tiene 2 hijos de él. Su compañero de vida, está en los estados unidos y le ayuda con los gastos de los 7 hijos que tiene en total, ya que cinco de sus hijos se encuentran estudiando.

Ella por su parte, trabaja en la elaboración de tortillas para la venta, desde hace  8 años; debido a que no tiene otra actividad a la cual ella se puede dedicar, y esta es la única fuente de negocio que posee. Debido a que  por la escases de recursos económicos, no se ha dedicado a otra actividad, ya que en este negocio, no necesita de tanta inversión económica. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 15 quintales de  maíz,  8 cargas de leña, 4 tambos de gas y 3 mesas. Con esto, incrementa sus ventas y sus ingresos, que le permitan tener un estilo de vida mejor al que tenía antes, ya que con esto, ayudara a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando. 

Sus sueños, es tener un buen negocio de tortillas, y posteriormente también se dedicara a la venta de pupusas. Ya que ella desea tener un negocio fuete que le permita obtener mejores ingresos, así mejorara su condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is 36 years old, and only studied up to third grade since she could not afford to continue her studies. She was married but her husband died 5 years ago, leaving her with 5 children. She has another 2 children with her subsequent partner. Her partner is now in the United States and helps her with the bills for the 7 children she has in total, since 5 of them are studying.

Silvia, for her part, works making and selling tortillas, and has been doing this for 8 years. She does not have any other line of work she could do, and so it is her only source of income. Due to her financial situation, she has not done anything else, since this business does not require so much economic investment.

The loan Silvia is asking for will be used to buy 15 hundredweights of corn, 8 loads of firewood, 4 gas canisters and 3 tables which will increase her sales and her income. This will allow her to have a better lifestyle than before, because with this, she will be able to help her children so that they can continue studying.

Her dream is to have a good tortilla business, and later to sell pupusas, as she wants to have a strong business that will allow her to earn more money and so improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Haydee De La  Paz

texts.es:
Haydee de 54 años, estudio hasta Bachillerato. Actualmente, está casada y su esposo se dedica al taller de estructuras metálicas, tiene 2 hijos.

Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, el cual desde hace 7 años, les prepara almuerzo a los profesores de la escuela de su Colonia. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para instalar una tienda en su casa, comprara productos de primera necesidad, ya que cerca de su casa hay una iglesia y una escuela que al aperturar la tienda le iría muy bien, mejoraría sus condiciones de vida porque con las ganancias va ir pagando las necesidades básicas y le ayudara a su esposo en los gastos, porque actualmente solo en él recae los gastos del hogar. 

El sueño es ampliar el negocio en un futuro, con las ganancias ir ahorrando y salir de la deuda, espera en un futuro si todo le sale como lo espera, hacer un préstamo para surtir la tienda.
texts.en:
54-year-old Haydee finished secondary school. She is currently married and her husband works in a metal workshop. She has two children.

She has been working as a housekeeper for seven years, and prepares lunch for teachers from her community’s school. She is requesting a loan at Fundación Campo to open a store at home. She will buy staple products, thinking that there are a church and a school close to where she lives, which represent potential business. She would improve her living conditions. With the profits, she would cover the basic expenses and help her husband to maintain their family, since he is paying for everything at the moment.

Her dream is to expand her business in the future, save some of the profits and pay back the loan. She hopes, if everything goes as planned, that she can request a loan to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy staple products to open a store at home.

loans.name: Ismoilkhon

texts.ru: Исмоилхон 56 летний фермер, семьянин. Он родом он из села Янгиобод района Шахритус. До сих пор Исмоилхон живет и работает там же. Исмоилхон около 10 лет кредитовался у местных банков. Но узнал что у МДО "Хумо" можно взять кредит по низкой ставке и за короткие сроки. Поэтому он обратился в "Хумо" за выгодным кредитом, чтобы начать свой новый бизнес по животноводству. Исмоилхон планирует заняться куплей и продажей крупного рогатого скота. У него имеется собственный капитал в виде двухэтажного коровника и корма для скота. На сумму от кредита Исмоилхон хочет приобрести 6 голов коров и телят. У него имеется свой бизнес-план по откорму и продаже скота и будет придерживаться его в ходе ведения своего бизнеса. Сейчас он ждет поддержки, чтобы начать бизнес.
texts.en: Ismoilkhon is a 56-year-old farmer and family man. He was born in the village of Yangiobod in the region of Shahritus. To this day, Ismoilkhon still lives and works in that very village. Ismoilkhon had been taking out loans from local banks for about 10 years. But he discovered that through MLO Humo and Partners one can take out a loan at a low rate and over a short term. For that reason he turned to Humo to get a advantageous loan, in order to start his own new livestock-breeding business. Ismoilkhon plans to buy and sell cattle. He has personal equity in the form of a two floor cowshed and food for the livestock. With the money from the loan, Ismoilkhon wants to purchase 6 cows and calves. He has a business plan about how best to fatten and sell the livestock and he plans to stick to the plan while planning his business. Now he awaits support in order to start his business.

loans.use: to start a business trading livestock

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 38 años, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Alejandrina se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles. Tiene su tienda en donde atiende durante las mañanas con mucho esmero, ofrece a la venta artículos de primera necesidad como huevos, arroz, plátano, harina, leche y otros. Lleva en este trabajo 07 años y le va muy bien. Por las tardes vende comida en la vereda de su casa a partir de las 05 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche aproximadamente. Actualmente tiene todos sus esfuerzos orientados a expandir e incrementar su tienda para dejar de realizar la venta de comida y empezar a disfrutar sus años al lado de sus hijos. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues siempre considera que su pasión es la atención al público y el trato directo con ellos, es por eso que todos sus trabajos han tenido esta orientación, espera seguir trabajando con mayor esmero y hacer crecer su negocio. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, embutidos, leche, huevos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 38 years old, and is divorced. She lives with her three children in their own home. Alejandrina works selling food products. She has her shop where she opens in the mornings with care. She has necessary items for sale such as eggs, rice, bananas, flour, milk etc. She has been doing this for 7 years and it is going very well. In the afternoons she sells food outside her home from 5pm till approximately 10pm. 

She is currently focusing all her efforts on expanding and improving her shop so that she can stop selling food in the evenings and start to enjoy the years she has with her children. She enjoys what she does because she always considers her passion is the attention to the public and the direct contact with them. This is why all her work involves this kind of interaction. She hopes to continue working with care and develop her business. 

This Alejandrina's second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she receives to help her get ahead. She also is committed to making her loan repayments on time. With the amount of 1000 soles, she will buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, cold meats, milk, eggs etc.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 24 años, es un mujer amable y emprendedora, hace 04 años está casada con Freddy y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. El trabajo de Liz consiste en la venta de gaseosas al público en general, además vende ropa para niños y adolescentes. Ha establecido recientemente su pequeño negocio en la puerta del lugar donde vive, pero se dedica a esta actividad cerca de 05 años, siempre ha trabajado sola porque así se siente más tranquila ya que considera que de esa forma mantiene el orden y no tiene ninguna presión al momento de atender a sus clientes. Se siente muy feliz porque sabe que todas las actividades laborales que realiza le produce los ingresos económicos que necesita para solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar, sin embargo sabe que tiene que continuar esforzándose muchísimo para mantener esta situación, espera seguir trabajando para hacer crecer aún más su negocio y más adelante comprarse un terreno para construir su casa y ahí establecer como negocio un pequeño bar. Este es su crédito número 02 con Kiva, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir una vez más con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/. 500 comprará gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en: Twently-four-year-old Liz is friendly and enterprising.  She has been married to Freddy for four years and she has two children, with whom she lives in a rented house.  Liz's work is selling fizzy drinks.  She also sells clothes for children and teenagers.  Liz has had the business for nearly five years but she recently moved the business to sell from the door of her house.  Liz has always worked alone as she feels more at ease like this: she can keep things in order and there is no pressure when she is serving her customers.  Liz feels very happy because she knows that all of the work she does earns her an income, which she needs to cover basic household costs.  However, Liz needs to continue putting in the effort in order to maintain this income.  She hopes to continue working so that she can expand the business further and, in the future, buy a plot of land to build her house and to start a new business, a small bar.  This is Liz's second Kiva loan.  She is grateful for the opportunity and for the trust being put in her. Liz promises to make her repayments on time. This loan of 500 Nuevo Soles will be used to buy fizzy drinks in bulk.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery, de 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en un cuarto alquilado en compañía de su madre y su hija de 07 años de edad. Mery se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, cumple esta labor en las zonas aledañas a los ríos hasta donde viaja de manera frecuente por el río, los pobladores de dichos caseríos le solicitan diversas ropas, consigue la ropa en distintos centros comerciales de la ciudad y luego los vende en cada lugar que visita, realiza ésta labor hace 05 años. Trabaja sola. Cuando se encuentra en la ciudad se dedica a la venta de golosinas como galletas, caramelos y otros. Le gustan ambas actividades que realiza ya que la mantiene ocupada y puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hija. Este es el segundo crédito con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 
S/. 600, comprará diversos ropa de segunda mano para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Mery, who is 35, is a single mother, and lives in a rented room, together with her mother and her daughter, who is 7 years old. She sells used clothes in the areas along the river, on which she travels. Her products are in great demand among the people there. She buys the clothes in various shopping centres in the city and then sells them door-to-door, an activity she has been engaged in for the last five years. She works alone. When she goes to the city, she takes the opportunity to sell snacks such as cookies, sweets, and others. She likes both her jobs since they keep her busy and enable her to pay for household expenses and for her daughter's education. This is her second loan through Kiva, for which she would like to thank those who make her loan possible in order to help her reach her goals. She promises to be punctual in her repayments. With the 600 soles she asks for, she will buy various articles of used clothing in order to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy used clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Sinmadokinto Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SINMADOKINTO est un groupe composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Alougba (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 53 ans. Alougba n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Alougba est veuve avec cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Alougba vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de ménage sont supportées par Alougba. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Alougba vend du gari (farine à base de manioc) dans sa région depuis dix ans. Alougba s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Alougba s’associe aux autres membres du groupe SINMADOKINTO pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Sinmadokinto group is made up of five women who all live in the same village.  The group representative is Alougba (with her hand raised in the photo).  Alougba is 53 years old and didn't go to school.  She is a widow with five children, some of whom attend school.  Alougba lives alone with her children and supports the household herself.  To do this, she sells gari (manioc or casssava flour) locally.  She has done this for ten years and buys her supplies at a market in Bénin.

In order to improve her business, Alougba has joined with the other women in the Sinmadokinto group to request  this second loan from the field partner Alidé.  Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy cassava.

loans.name: Yemalin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YEMALIN est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée Anagonou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 43 ans. Anagonou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Anagonou est mariée à un certain Jérémie. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Anagonou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Anagonou et son mari. Pour ce faire, Anagonou vend du maïs et de l'huile de palme. De façon secondaire, achète du manioc pour en faire de la farine de manioc et en revendre. Anagonou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Anagonou s’associe aux autres membres du groupe YEMALIN pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
YEMALIN Group is made up of three people who live in the same village. The group's representative is raising her hand in the photograph. Her name is Anagonou, she's 43 years old, and married to one Jérémie. The couple has three school-attending children, whom they have to support.

Anagonou never attended school. She lives with her husband and children. The household expenses are taken care of by herself and her husband. For this reason, she sells corn and palm oil. As a secondary business, she buys cassava and transforms it into into tapioca that she resells. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

Eager to bolster her business, Anagonou, together with the other members of YEMALIN Group, is seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The previous loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy corn and cassava

loans.name: Alodoalome Group

texts.fr: ALODOALOME est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. Le représentant du groupe, nommé Sonagnon Angelbert (celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgé de 36 ans. Sonagnon Angelbert est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Joséphine. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. En dehors de ses enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Sonagnon Angelbert vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Sonagnon Angelbert fait l'élevage des coquelets depuis trois ans dans sa région, et les revend. Sonagnon Angelbert s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de développer son activité, Sonagnon Angelbert s’associe aux autres membres du groupe ALODOALOME pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Alodoalome is a group made up of three people who live in the same village. The representative of the group, named Sonagnon Angelbert (pictured with his hand raised in the photo) is 36 years old. Sonagnon Angelbert is married to a reseller named Joséphine. The couple has two children, both of whom attend school and are in their care. In addition to their own children, the couple also has another child in their care. Sonagnon Angelbert lives with his wife and children, and together the couple provides for the needs of the household.

In order to provide for his family, Sonagnon Angelbert has been in the business of raising chicks and reselling them in his region for three years. He stocks up within his region. In order to grow his business, Sonagnon Angelbert, together with the other members of the Alodoalome group, are requesting their second loan from ALIDé. Their first loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase feed and chicks

loans.name: Lucrèce Edjrossè's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Lucrèce Edjrossè (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 32 ans. Lucrèce Edjrossè est mariée à un certain Guérin. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas scolarisé et est à leur charge. Lucrèce Edjrossè assiste son mari dans les différentes charges de ménage. Pour y parvenir, Lucrèce Edjrossè vend des tissus, des ustensiles de cuisine et des chaussures par la technique de distribution. Lucrèce Edjrossè s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Lucrèce Edjrossè s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who all live in the same village. The representative of the group, named Lucrèce Edjrossè (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 32 years old. She is married to a man named Guérin. The couple has one child who does not attend school and is in their care. Lucrèce Edjrossè helps her husband with the various household expenses.

In order to provide for her family, Lucrèce Edjrossè sells cloth, kitchen utensils, and shoes by distribution. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to grow her business and to meet the demands of her customers, Lucrèce Edjrossè partnered with the other members of her group to request a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, kitchen utensils, and shoes

loans.name: Ayaba Yvette Houéfa's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ayaba Yvette Houéfa (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 27 ans. Ayaba Yvette Houéfa est mariée à un certain Bruno. Le couple a un enfant, qui n'est pas scolarisé et est à leur charge. Ayaba Yvette Houéfa assiste son mari dans les différentes charges de ménage. Pour y parvenir, Ayaba Yvette Houéfa vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et des fournitures scolaires à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Ayaba Yvette Houéfa exerce la fonction d'opératrice de saisie dans une structure de la place. Ayaba Yvette Houéfa s'approvisionne dans sa région. En vue d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Ayaba Yvette Houéfa s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative is the woman raising her hand in the photograph. Her name is Ayaba Yvette Houéfa and she's 27 years old. She's married to one Bruno. The couple has one child who doesn't go to school, and for whom they are financially responsible.

Ayaba Yvette Houéfa helps her husband cover the various household expenses. To manage it, she sells phone recharge cards and school supplies at her home. As a secondary business, she works as a data input operator in a local company.

She gets her supplies in her region. In order to bolster her revenue and meet customer demand, Ayaba Yvette Houéfa, joined by the other members of her group, is seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards and school supplies

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe JIGUIYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  Fama  un des quartiers de Sikasso  faisant partie de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme DJELIKA assise à l’extrême droite fait le commerce de tubercules.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des tubercules en grande quantité qu’elle revendra en détail à Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Jiguiya group are married women who are on average 38 years old with 4 children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Fama, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their second loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.

Djelika, pictured seated on the far right, is in the tuber business. She plans to use her loan to purchase tubers in bulk which she will resell at retail in Sikasso, both from a stand and door to door, for cash to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, a portion of which she will use to repay the loan and interest, and the rest she will save.

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura continúa  viviendo  en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella continua con la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, ella también se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria en la puerta de su domicilio solo los días domingos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Maura requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para continuar preparando  mas platos típicos de la región, ella comprará insumos al por mayor como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. 

Maura continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maura continues to live in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, where she does all kinds of activities. She continues to raise small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She also sells food as a street vendor in the door of her home, just on Sundays. She has been working in this business for several years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion Maura needs the loan to buy supplies so that she can continue preparing more traditional dishes of the region. She will buy supplies at wholesale, such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles and other things.

Maura continues as a member of the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank of the Arariwa Association and is grateful for the opportunity offered through this organization. As well, she is comitted to making her loan repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: To buy supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Making and selling charcoal is the primary income source for Edna’s family. She’s thankful because through this business, she’s able to provide for the needs of her two children. She would like to develop her business and somehow shift into other business that will not contribute danger to the environment, but will give provide more income. 

Edna is 36 years old. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that will be used in buying wood for making charcoal. She is hoping that with this additional capital, she would be able to earn a higher income and provide good stability for her family.

loans.use: to use in buying wood for making charcoal.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old, separated, and a resident of Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur. She earns a living through farming.

She has been a member of PMPC for one year and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 3,000 to to buy additional farming tools.

Jocelyn deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional farming tools.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 48-year-old woman from the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. She is married with three children; the youngest child is 19. 

Angelina farms; she grows and sells rice to help augment the income of their household. She started her business a year ago.  Aside from farming, she also raises pigs. She is asking for a loan to buy additional pigs, pig feed, and pig vitamins. 

In the future, Angelina  hopes to expand her both business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, pig feed, and pig vitamins

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 53 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Daisy works in the fish industry, catching fish for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. 

She has requested a loan to buy additional fishing materials and accessories such as snap swivels, floats or bobbers, sinkers, terminal tackle, gear, fish hooks,etc.

Daisy has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Daisy hopes to improve and further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials and accessories such as snap swivels, floats or bobbers, sinkers, terminal tackle, gear, fish hooks, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 63 years old, married with four children, and a resident of Brgy. Sta. Maria, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Carmen sells bananas to earn a living, and had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 for additional capital to buy bananas for her buy & sell business.

Carmen has been a member of PMPC for five years.  

In the future, she hopes to have her own banana plantation to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to get additional capital to buy a stock of bananas.

loans.name: Buenafe

texts.en:
Buenafe is married with three children; she is 30 years old, and lives in Pan-ay Clarin, Philippines.

Buenafe sells a variety of consumer products to earn a living, and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase additional products to sell such as biscuits, flakes, chocolates, candies, yogurt, drinks, noodles, canned goods, beauty soaps, detergents, etc.

Buenafe has been a member of PMPC for four years.  

In the future, Buenafe hope to start another profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as biscuits, flakes, chocolates, candies, yogurt, drinks, noodles, canned goods, beauty soaps, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 61 years old; she is separated, with four adult children, and she lives in Medallo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.

Perlita has engage in a sari-sari store business for three years, earning a monthly income of 3,500. 

She requested a new loan to purchase various materials for her house renovation. Income from her store business will support the loan payments. 

Perlita has been a member of Microfinance of Paglaum MPC since 2010. She aims to have more savings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house renovation

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 38 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married but has no dependents. 

Divina is engaged in hog fattening, and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase sacks of feed for her existing hog fattening business.
 
Divina joined PMPC just this year. 

In the future, Divina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
This is Joel; he previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that he will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit.  The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. Joel dreams that his business will continue to grow. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

He is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to believe more in God’s love for mankind. The Bible sharing allows him to learn more about the life of God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell at her business.

Jelita has been in this business for 9 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling honey bee juice.

Jelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Juliet is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, fish, etc for her restaurant business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, fish, etc

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 44 years old, married, and has nine children. Four of her children are in school; she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 39-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.

Three years ago, he decided to start a retail shop to supplement his farming activities, which are seasonal. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation are his major challenges, while his dreams are to educate his children up to the University, buy land, and own a wholesale shop.

George intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as tooth brushes and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as tooth brushes and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en: Fabiano is a 37-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a farmer, and he has been able to pay school fees for his children with the proceeds. Like most farmers, he is challenged by prolonged dry seasons and diseases. His dream is to venture into modern farming so as to improve on the yields. Fabiano intends to use this loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nabonswende Group

texts.fr:
Mme KADIDIA représente le groupe NABONSWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 02ans06moins et le moins âgé a 01an01mois. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 08ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 et au grand marché. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 25complets pagnes  simple et 15complets de pagnes  Bazin.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne étendre la limite de son activité et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en: Kadidia represents the Nabonswende group. She is married and the mother of 2 children, the oldest of whom is 2 years 6 months old, and the youngest of whom is 1 year and 1 month old. None of her children attend school and she has 3 people in her care. Kadidia has been selling "pagnes" (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for 8 years. She stocks up at the market in Sector 10 and at the big market. Her customers are both men and women. She wants to purchase 25 outfits of simple cloth, and 15 outfits made of brocade. Kadidia plans to reinvest her profits into her business, and hopes to expand her business and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase 25 simple outfits and 15 outfits made of brocade

loans.name: Maryori Nataly

texts.es:
Maryori es una joven madre de 27 años de edad tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad casada, agricultora y ama de casa que en compañía de su esposo se dedica al cultivo de café y piña. Ella tiene 12 años de educación por lo que pudo estudiar su primaria y secundaria de manera favorable y obtener un conocimiento para poderlo aplicar a su vida y a sus negocios graduándose como perito mercantil y contador público. Ella es comerciante mientras no está trabajando en la tierra dedicándose a la venta de piña y coco siendo sus clientes los viajeros que se desplazan hacia los diferentes lados del país ya que su puesto de venta se encuentra en un lugar muy estratégico ubicado en la CA-5 la cual conecta al país de norte a sur. En la parte de la agricultura lleva más de 10 años trabajando ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñara desde muy pequeña siendo ellos quienes también le heredaran un pedazo de tierra para trabajar el cual fue creciendo por medio de la buena administración de las ganancias y fortaleciendo poco a poco. El terreno que en compañía de su esposo trabajan está ubicado a 1 kilómetro de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual diariamente se trasladan caminando.
Sus metas son las de ser una de las mejores productoras de la zona obtener una buena calidad de producto para que su clientela sea permanente y pueda siempre ser confiable. Como madre darle una buena educación a su hijo y los venideros fortalecer el patrimonio para que ellos puedan enfrentar la vida de manera favorable y puedan dar el sustento a sus familias. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento para fortalecer sus cultivos de piña y café comprando los insumos necesario que harán de sus cultivos más atractivos y evitaran el contagio de enfermedades y plagas.
texts.en:
Maryori is a young mother who is 27 years old, her son is 5 years old. She is married and a housewife who works with her husband growing coffee and pineapples. She had 12 years of education which meant she studied at primary and secondary school and obtained knowledge that she could apply to her life and her businesses, graduating as a business expert and public accountant.

She is a businesswoman while she is not working on the land working selling pineapples and coconuts. Her customers are travelers who travel between different parts of the country as her stall is located in a very strategic spot on the CA-5 which connects the north and south of the country.

She has spent more than 10 years in agriculture since it was her parents who taught her from a very young age, and who also left her a plot of land to work which she expanded through good administration of her earnings and strengthening it bit by bit. The land which she works with her husband is located 1km from her house which she walks to daily.

Her aim is to be one of the best producers in the area, and obtain a good quality of product so that her customers become regulars and can always be trusted. As a mother she wants to give her son a good education and to strengthen their inheritance for their descendents so that they can face life in a positive way and can support their families. This is why she is now asking for a loan to strengthen their pineapple and coffee crops, buying the necessary supplies that will make her crops look better and avoid the spreading of diseases and infestations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost and urea for her crops.

loans.name: María Erlinda

texts.es:
María de 42 años, estudio hasta 5° grado. Actualmente, está casada y su pareja es agricultor, tienen 5 hijos y 4 viven en casa, asisten a la escuela a 3° año de bachillerato,  7°, 2° y a kínder respectivamente.

Ella, realiza la cliente oficios domésticos y desde hace 18 años, se ha dedicado al molino el cual ha sido patrimonio de su madre; ahora es propio, lo tiene en su casa, y su hija mayor le ayuda con el negocio y el horario de trabajo es de todos los días de 6 a 11 am. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar la conexión de energía eléctrica, ya que su hija la mayor  y su nieta se irán a vivir a otra casa y no posee este servicio, y la Alcaldía de la comunidad les otorga un permiso, para que este mes hagan los trámites para la conexión. 

Espera que a su hija le vaya muy bien en su nueva epata de vida y que sus otros hijos sigan estudiando, para que se preparen en un futuro; además desea seguir trabajando con el molino para darles todo lo necesario a su hijos.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and completed up to the end of fifth grade.  She is married and her husband is a farmer.  They have five children, four of whom live at home.  The children are all in school - the oldest is in third year at high school, while the next two are in seventh and second grade of primary school, respectively.  The youngest is at nursery.

María makes a living doing domestic chores and, for 18 years, she has worked with a grinder, which she inherited from her mother.  María now owns the grinder and has it in her home.  María's eldest daughter helps her with the business.  She works with this business from 6am to 11am.

María is applying for this loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to pay the connection charge for electricity, as María's eldest daughter, and her granddaughter, are moving to another house and the need electricity.  They have been granted permission to have electricity for the house by the town hall, and this month they will complete all the necessary paperwork.

María hopes that things will go will for her daughter in this new stage of her life.  She hopes that her other children will continue to study so as to prepare themselves for the future.  María wants to continue working with the grinder so as to give her children everything that they need.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity connection.

loans.name: Ariel Josué

texts.es:
Ariel de 30 años de edad, vive junto a su hija de 4 años de edad, y su  compañera de vida, con quien convive desde hace 6 años, Ella se dedica a vender ropa, cosméticos y tamales; se independizó desde que nació su hija.

Él por su parte, se  dedica a trabajar en estructuras metálicas en una empresa constructora, actualmente tiene 6 meses. Aprendió el oficio a los 18 años, con un amigo, después,  6 años trabajó en el área de mantenimiento en el ingenio.  


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar ropa, cosméticos y cancelar un préstamo vigente en Fundación CAMPO.

Con la inversión, fortalecerá con capital de trabajo a la familia y les apoyara para que la esposa, continúe trabajando  y aproveche la temporada navideña.

Al capitalizarse, se espera que la familia mejore sus ingresos y por ende sus condiciones de vida.

Su deseo es, establecer su negocio y apoyar a su esposa con los gastos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ariel is 30 years old and lives with his life partner and their daughter, who is 4 years old. The couple has been together for six years. She has been selling clothes, cosmetics and tamales since the daughter's birth. He works with metallic structures in construction companies and has been with the one for which he is currently working for six months. He learned the trade at 18 thanks to a friend. Then he worked for six years in maintenance in the field of engineering. Ariel asks for a loan in order to buy clothes and cosmetics, and to repay a loan with the field partner. The idea is to invest in the family's working capital, so that his wife is able to continue working and can take advantage of the boost in sales that is sure to come with Christmas. The goal of increasing the working capital is to improve the family's earnings, and thus, its living conditions. Ariel's wish is to set up his own shop and to help his wife with expenses, in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics, and to repay a current loan with the field partner.

loans.name: Virgen Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Grimanesa ella es casada y tiene 53 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,galletas y dulces,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite galletas.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Virgen Guadalupe.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de maiz.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the “Virgen Guadalupana” communal bank are located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department. 

The featured member, Señora Grimanesa, is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She works in her shop selling groceries and necessary items such as rice, sugar, biscuits and sweets. She works from 6 am - 10 pm. Her dream is to expand her grocery business. She is asking for a loan to buy products for the grocery shop such as rice, sugar, milk, oil and biscuits.

The person in the picture whose face is concealed is not a member of the “Virgen Guadalupana” communal bank.
The person whose photo is added to the group took the photo after the group photo - he asked permission for work motives.
The other members work selling food, selling vegetables, raising animals and selling corn.

Señora Grimanesa is thankful to thos who are part of her dream through this medium, and is committed to paying her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store (rice, sugar, milk, oil and biscuits).

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín continúa con su profesión de carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica diferentes tipos de muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, mesas, roperos, camas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Efraín requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, clavos, pintura y otras cosas más. 
  
Efraín  continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Efrain is still working as a carpenter and has a small shop located in his residence, where he makes wooden furniture, such as chairs, tables, dressers, and beds, among other things. In this occasion, Efrain needs a loan to buy materials such as wood, nails, paint, and so on. Efrain continues to work with the community bank "Mamacha Rosario" from the Arariwa Association, he is thankful for the opportunity given to him through this loan and commits to make repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, nails, paint and other.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella continua con la elaboración  de artesanía como por ejemplo chompas y frazadas pero también ahora está ayudando a su esposo en la elaboración de muebles de madera con el acabado de los muebles. 

En esta oportunidad Virginia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Virginia continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (La socia aparece en la fotografia junto con su esposo).
texts.en: Virginia continues living in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, and this is where she does all types of activities. She continues with making crafts, such as sweaters and blankets, but she also now is helping her husband make wood furniture by doing finishing on the furniture. At this time, Virginia requires a loan to buy more materials, such as wood. It has already been many years that she has worked in this business, and it has been going very well thanks to the determination she puts into her work. Virginia continues with the community bank “Mamacha Rosario” of the microfinance organization Asociación Arariwa, and she is thankful for the opportunity offered through this group. As a result, she promises to comply with repaying the loan according to the schedule. Virginia appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more materials, such as wood.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa. 

Alejandrina continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades personales, económicas y familiares, ella continua con la venta de comida y con la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo fideos, azúcar, verduras, carne, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Alejandrina continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is grateful to the investors for the support they have offered and hopes they continue to support all of her fellow borrowers working with Asociacion Arariwa.  She still lives in the city of Huancarani where she carries out her personal, business and family activities. She continues with her work in agriculture and food sales. It has now been several years that she has been doing this work and it has been going very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.

At this time Alejandrina needs a loan so that she can buy more staple food items such as noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, etc. She still is with Asociacion Arariwa's "Mama Rosario" community bank and is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving from them.  She pledges that she will make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more basic household products such as noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa. 

Celia continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades personales y económicas, ella continua  dedicándose a la cosecha, cultivo y a vender cereales como   por ejemplo trigo, cebada, moraya seca, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Celia requiere el préstamo para compra semillas y abonos, pues continua en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celia is grateful to lenders for the support provided and wishes that they will keep supporting all members of the Asociación Arariwa. 

Celia still lives in the city of Huancarani, province of Huancarani, where she performs her personal and economic activities. She keeps working in agriculture, cultivating and selling cereals such as wheat and barley, dehydrated potatoes and corn, among others. She has worked in this business for several years and has been successful thanks to her hard work. 

Celia is now requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is still a member of the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" within the Asociación Arariwa, and feels grateful for the opportunity provided. She commits to repay as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jerez Mae

texts.en:
Jerez Mae is married with 1 child. She is 28 years old and lives in Bagumbang Bonifacio.

Jerez Mae sells gasoline to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase liters of gasoline for retailing.

Jerez Mae has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Jerez Mae hopes to own a gasoline station.

loans.use: To purchase liters of gasoline to sell retail

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is 43 years old, married and has four children. She is engaged in a hog fattening business. She has been in this business for over six months and very much thankful that the business contributed a lot to her family's income. Now, Phoebe wants to access a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, medicine and piglets. She hopes that she can produce more healthy pigs through the amount requested to earn a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products like coffee, food supplements and whitening products.

loans.name: Rosegine

texts.en:
Rosegine is 46 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in Dban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

Rosegine is engaged in a sari-sari business in the market where she sells things such as vegetables, groceries and dried fish. Rosegine earns a monthly income of 18,000 PHP. 

She requested a new loan to purchase additional goods and vegetables. Rosegine has been a Cumi member of Paglaum since 2007. She hopes to earn more and save more from her business.

loans.use: to purchase various vegetables and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 29 years old, married and blessed with two children. 

She has been operating a livestock and fish selling business. She would like to increase the number of ducks but she feels financial insufficiency. This led Edlyn to request PHP 5,000 to buy more ducklings to care for. Part of the loan will be used to purchase fingerlings (small fish) that she will raise in her fishpond. 

With her determination, she’s able to develop her business but her desire to keep improving it and somehow become successful motivated her to borrow the loan.

loans.use: to buy more ducklings and fingerlings that she will raise in her fishpond.

loans.name: Chirel

texts.en:
Chirel is 28 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, etc.

Chirel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. Chirel hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Annbell

texts.en:
Annbell is a single lady aged 26 years old and supporting three members of her family.  Her children are aged 8 and 3 years old.  She sells second-hand clothes in Kabarnet and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning an income of Kes 20,000.

She has now requested her second loan of Kes 30,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes for resale.  The profits she earns will be used as savings and also to repay the loan.

Her dream is to have a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 40 years old, married and has six children. Five of her children are in school, so she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alona has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to resell.

Alona has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine used the previous loan to buy local brew to sell. She is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For ten years, she has been selling local brew, and she has been able to pay for school fees for her children with the proceeds. Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification despite her low income and high license fees. Her business dream is to install a liquor processing plant so as to add value to her product. Justine intends to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and married with five children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from "nipa" (palm frond sheets) roofing.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has six children.  She operates a farm, which she has been doing for 20 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business. Her biggest challenge is bad weather.

Peninah is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase poultry.  During Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, she learned about asset funding. Peninah's highest monthly expense is farming costs. With the loan, she hopes to earn more income.

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peninah owns the following: cow, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. She has in the household a mosquito net and solar power but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Evelita

texts.en:
Evelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Evelita earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.
